Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por la oportunidad de ayuda que me brindaron para poder sostener mi casa”.
texts.en: Nora offered some new products that she debuted at events that people hired her for.  This was thanks to her Kiva loan, which allowed her to buy raw materials and supplies.  She managed to have the guests at first communions, 15th birthday celebrations, graduations, etc. try out the delicacies she made with her products.  Now she is very enthusiastic and is applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy more raw materials and supplies to make snacks, and to stock up for the schools with which she has a contract which she must fulfill.  This way she can earn a bit more money and increase her working capital.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following "Thank you for this opportunity and the help you are providing me so that I can support my household."

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make snacks

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Khon is 45 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. All of her children are employed. They earn about 8 USD per day. Due to lack of funds, Khon is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a house for her child, who is married. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her child. In the future, she would like to run grocery store and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her living.

loans.use: to purchase a house for her child who is married

loans.name: Dina Elenita

texts.en:
Dina Elenita is 52 years old and married with 3 children.

Dina Elenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Dina Elenita has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from E-loading and personal products sales.

Dina Elenita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old and married with five children.

To make a living, Julieta cultivates corn land and bananas. Julieta has been in her business for 15 years and earns 11,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Julieta joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is from Caniangan, Ozamis City. She is 55 years old. Jovita is a widow and has one child.

To make a living, she manages a business planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Jovita joined GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a loan of 5,900 PHP which will be used to buy seedlings to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to expand the business

loans.name: Sareit

texts.en:
Sareit is 37 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $10 per day.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sareit is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase more groceries to resell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more profit to support her family.

In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Mustafo

texts.ru: Более 15 лет Мустафо занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он заботливый и трудолюбивый семьянин, на воспитании имеет троих детей. В бизнесе помогает жена и дети, они все дружно работают. Его земля нуждается в обработке, чтобы получить  хороший урожай и продать за выгодную цену. Мустафо запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов и оплаты труда работникам. Мустафо надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mustafa has been farming for more then fifteen years. He is a caring and hardworking family man, and has three children. His wife and kids help Mustafa on the farm and they all work well together. Mustafa's fields need to be amended so that they can produce a bountiful crop for the market. Mustafa is requesting this loan to pay seeds, fertilizer, fuel and salaries for his farm hands. He hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizes, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen is 37 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in rice and cassava cultivation. She earns about $9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Additionally, he is a construction worker. All of her children are still in her care. In order to improve her business, Chhen is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants to cultivate. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and additional livestock to raise.

Leonisa has been raising livestock for 12 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia recibió un credikiva y con él compró materias primas e insumos al por mayor, con los que ganó buenos descuentos; también arregló el techo que se encontraba en regular estado y no permitía un trabajo productivo efectivo. Ahora planea aplicar a un nuevo credikiva, para comprar utensilios de cocina y una estufa, pues la que tiene se encuentra deteriorada; así mismo invertirá el resto en materias prima e insumos para aumentar su producción y de esta manera trabajar en condiciones mas confortables y obtener descuentos por sus compra de contado y en mayor volumen, lo cual se convertirá en un ahorro que trasladará a sus utilidades.
texts.en: Cecilia received a Kiva loan, and with it she bought raw materials and supplies at wholesale, where she got a good discount.  She also fixed the roof, which was in bad condition and was not allowing her to work effectively.  Now she plans to apply for a new Kiva loan to buy cooking utensils and a stove, as the one she has is deteriorated.  She will also invest in raw materials and supplies to increase her production.  This way she can work in more comfortable conditions, and obtain discounts for buying bulk and buying in cash.  With this cost saving, she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and a stove, and to buy raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 49 years old, married and has 4 children; 2 of whom are in school.

Eugenia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Eugenia has been raising pigs for 16 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eugenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and married with three children.

Joyce works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, curls and other miscellaneous items. Joyce has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Joyce aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, curls and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 52, a resident of Dasma, Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to Genaro, a government employee. She is a mother of 3 children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses and save for the futures of her grandchildren.

Adelaida is a rice dealer. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy sacks of rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Juarlita

texts.en:
Juarlita is 67 years old and widowed. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Juarlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. Juarlita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Juarlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 64 years old and a widow with six children.

Leonarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, noodles, sugar, and other groceries.

Leonarda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Leonarda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, bread, noodles, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sien

texts.en: Sien is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and cassava for more than twenty years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her child is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sien is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase fertilizer and cassava plant to cultivate. This money will help her expand her business and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to generate more profit to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel padre y esposo un hombre trabajador, responsable y honrado ha hecho muchos sacrificios por su familia. Siempre trabaja horas extras para que el salario le rinda un poco más y tener un nivel de vida bueno para la familia. Se esposa trabaja de distribuidora de vales en una zapatería y entre los dos han sacado adelante a su unida familia. El sueño de Gabriel es que su hijo complete sus estudios y ahora ve por patrimonio que le dejara un día. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro y la fachada de su casa. Agradecería la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Mr. Gabriel is a father, husband, hardworking, responsible, and honorable man who has made many sacrifices for his family. He always works overtime so they can have a little more income and better life quality. His wife is a shoe distributer at a shoe store and has also helped the family financially. Gabriel’s dream is for his son to complete his education and be able to leave him all of his assets. The loan will be used to build a wall and facade for his home. He is thankful for the help being offered.

loans.use: wall construction

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita, 36, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paquito, an electrician. She is also a mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also offers electronic load (pre-paid cell phone credits) business and also operates a tailoring business. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estelita hopes to be able to expand soon. She’s happy to have a simple and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cristino José

texts.es:
Actualmente abita, departamento de León, el Joven Cristino José. Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy dedicada al trabajo debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa y su familia y ha logrado mantener su hogar que tanto ama y estima, cuenta con 4 hijos bajo su cargo. 

Cristino se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador en el empeño de sus labores y con buenos valores ha logrado obtener mucho aprecio de las personas del municipio. 

 Actualmente acudido a Ceprodel  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vida saludable, para él está solicitando crédito, para la compra de medicamento, para el bien estar de su salud.
texts.en:
At the moment Cristino José lives in the León department. He considers himself as a person who is very dedicated to his work since he has always cared for his family’s well-being and has maintained his home which he loves and is very proud of. He is raising 4 children.
Cristino considers himself to be an excellent worker and with his good values has greatly appreciated the individuals of the municipal.
At the moment he requested Ceprodel a loan to take care of his health by buying medication.

loans.use: buy medication

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is 31 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband and her parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a silversmith who earns about $7 per day. Her children are still in her care. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phally is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 61, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite Philippines. Her husband is Hermenio, a plumber. Maria has four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a normal family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
This is Norberta, 55, a resident of Dasma, Cavite, Philippines. She is a parent and mother to her child. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Norberta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  She also does direct selling business for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Norberta hopes to be able to expand soon as she dreams to be a successful business woman someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino con su anterior credikiva compró celulares de gama baja y accesorios muy modernos que vendió y con sus ingresos invirtió nuevamente en pedidos de su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará celulares más modernos, gafas, cosméticos y accesorios para celulares, con el fin de tener inventarios suficientes con los cuales impactar a sus compradores y a potenciales clientes que Paulino quiere atraer y venderles. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco la confianza depositada en mi y espero continúen financiándome para progresar con mi negocio. “
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Paulino purchased low-end cell phones and modern cell phone accessories, which he sold, and he was able to invest the profits in filling customer orders. He is currently requesting a new loan with which he will purchase more modern cell phones and accessories, sunglasses, and cosmetics so that he can have the inventory needed to meet customer demand and attract potential customers. The following is his message to the Kiva lenders: "I appreciate the trust placed in me, and I hope that you will continue funding my business so that it can make progress."

loans.use: to purchase more modern cell phones and accessories, sunglasses, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is 64 years old, widowed, and has four children. He is from Pantaon, Ozamis City.

Cornelio used his last loan to purchase banana fertilizer. His business is successful and he is taking a new loan to purchase farm chemicals. In the future he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 31 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs. Approximately, she earns about $20 per day. Her husband runs a grinding rice service business and earns about $10 per day.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Pheap is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer to use in her rice cultivation. By doing so, rice would grow better and provide good harvest. In the future, she would like to run a rice mill and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use in her rice cultivation

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 54 years old and married with 4 children. Maria Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Maria Victoria has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and selling purified water.

Maria Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Thol is 35 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years, has an extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating cassava and purchasing cashew nut to resell.  She earns approximately $8 per day. Her husband is involved in fishing and earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Thol is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants to cultivate. This money will help her sustain the business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants to cultivate

loans.name: Shakila Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shakila bibi is a 24-years-old lady who owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and relatives and generates income for the family.  
Her family consists of four more members, including three daughters and a husband. Her daughters are very young and stay at home. Her husband is a very skilled person, involved in making iron boxes which are used to keep things like bed-sheets, clothes, etc.  
He has been doing this business for many years. In his years of experience, he has obtained a good reputation among his customers for his good work. He receives good orders from them and earns good income after finishing the orders on time. 
Shakila has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy iron sheets in bulk and other material for preparing the iron boxes. 
Shakila is very sure about her husband’s business success after this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and other material to make iron boxes.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
This is Tumenbayar. She is 53 years old, a mother of three children and also a good wife. Her elder daughters work out of the city while she lives with her spouse and son who attends local high school. 

She supports her family by writing and selling books. She wrote about 10 books before. Usually writes historical and fictional books for children. Most of her customers are kids who love to read books. Now she done her next book about a well-known historical Mongolian queen. The book is called “Golden Coin of Queen Durgunu.”

She needs to publish 326 books, which she will send to 326 schools in Mongolia. Thus, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to publish 326 books. 

“When sometimes I take too long to publish my books, children often ask from booksellers: when the next book will be ready to sell? Then booksellers ask me that question. In that moment I became really happy and get more energy from those words,” she said from the heart.

loans.use: to publish 326 books and send them to the 326 kindergartens in the area.

loans.name: Sokhey

texts.en: Sokhey is 26 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $8 per day. In order to improve her business, Sokhey is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase two sewing machines to use in her shop. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines to use in her shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana con su credikiva anterior compró al por mayor y de contado, productos naturales, ropa y perfumes que vendió prontamente y así mismo logró una buena rotación de su capital de trabajo. Ella está muy entusiasmada y se prepara para acceder a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado colonias, vestidos femeninos y productos naturales en una mayor escala porque necesita tener muchos mas inventarios porque adquirirá un local en condiciones de arrendamiento. Su credikiva será exitoso porque conoce el mercado, se ubicará muy cerca donde se encuentra su clientela y esto permitirá mayor afluencia de ellos en torno a su negocio. Su mensaje para los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado a mi microempresa, espero seguir progresando con estos prestamos a ta bajos intereses y sin tantos requisitos."
texts.en:
With her previous credikiva loan, Ana purchased at wholesale and for cash, natural products, clothing and perfumes, that she promptly sold and likewise achieved a rapid turnover of her working capital. 

She is very enthusiastic and ready to access a new credikiva loan, with which she will buy footwear, colognes, women's dresses and natural products on a larger scale. This is because she needs to have a great deal more inventory, because she will acquire a store on a rental basis. 

Her credikiva will be successful because she knows the market; she will be located very close to where her clientele is, and this will allow a greater of influx of customers for her business. 

Her message for Kiva lenders is the following: "I am very grateful for the support provided to my small business, and I hope to continue progressing with  these low-interest loans that have fewer requirements."

loans.use: To buy footwear, colognes, women's dresses, and natural products on a larger scale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She is very talented and has a creative nature. Her work is home based. She receives orders from her neighboring customers and earns income by completing the orders on time.   
She charges Pak Rupees 120 for a simple dress and Pak Rupees 180 for designer dresses. She sews dresses with perfect measurements. Her clients are very satisfied with her quality of work and they never argue with her on her charges.  
With the loan investment, she will purchase a new sewing machine and threads because her old machine doesn’t produce quality work and takes a lot of time to sew a single dress.  
She is hopeful that her business will be more established after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: You Y

texts.en: You Y is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge, Khmer noodles, and pancakes for more than ten years, earning approximately $12 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, You Y is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice to resell for a profit. By doing so, she will earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Uhuru

texts.en:
Uhuru is a widow and has six children who are between 32 and 15 years old. She lives in Kwale, Kenya where she works selling fried potatoes. For the past seven months, she’s been selling products at retail to support her home. Her greatest strength in her business development is her independent spirit. Since she was a girl she’d show this spirit to her parents. This is now reflected in the joy she gets from commercial activities she engages in to sell her products.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase sacks of potatoes at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful. This is why she’s very competitive when she sells products and is able to sell more each time.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Nicolasita

texts.en: Nicolasita is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Nicolasita is married and has four children. To earn a living, Nicolasita owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, toothpaste, junk foods, etc., in the local community. Nicolasita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Nicolasita joined GDMPC. Nicolasita is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Santiago Emiro

texts.es: Santiago está muy satisfecho porque con su credikiva adquirió hilo fino en un importante volumen,  produjo hamacas y bolsos que vendió e invirtió nuevamente, porque aumentaron sus pedidos en estos artículos. Ahora planea hacer su siguiente credikiva,  para invertir en nuevos hilos, para emular nuevos diseños  bolsos que traen desde Ciudad de Panamá  y que tienen buena acogida en la ciudad de Cartagena; con ellos tiene asegurada su venta, porque está basada en los pedidos que ha hecho su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de mucho agradecimiento y pide que sigan apoyando a los artesanos, para que mejoren así sus ingresos familiares y mas adelante puedan generar empleos para la gente que necesita trabajar.
texts.en: Santiago is very satisfied because he used his loan from Kiva to buy large quantities of thread, made more hammocks and bags he sold, and invested more in his business because the number of orders increased. He plans on requesting Kiva a second loan to buy more thread to design more bags, brought all of the way from Panamá, that are well received in the city of Cartagena. He can count on their business because he has many orders from them. He is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and asks for them to continue supporting artisans so that they can continue supporting their families and in the future generate more jobs for people who need them.

loans.use: buy thread

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy de 21 años de edad, creció viendo el reciclaje como una actividad productiva muy rentable, pues en su hogar se dedicaron a ella. Desde sus 19 años terminó sus estudios de bachiller y continuó  en la universidad, para ser analista de computación, carrera a la que aspira a terminar antes de finalizar este año. Ella también se dedica a la comercialización de chatarras y obtiene ingresos que le permiten su auto sostenimiento y con ellos ha logrado pagar su carrera en la universidad. Su meta es hacer crecer este negocio, pues está atenta a uno de los grandes desafíos de su vida, que es apoyar a su familia, en especial cuando su madre por motivos de su enfermedad recae y ella debe responder en su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para incrementar sus posibilidades de compras de chatarras de oportunidad, porque su mercado exige que ella tenga dinero suficiente, para hacer compras y vender de manera inmediata. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará los productos de mayor demanda, como cartón, cobre y aluminio, inversión que planea ser exitosa, en tanto a que ella obedece a su demanda y Cindy por experiencia en su tradición familiar sabe manejar muy bien su mercado.
texts.en: Cindy, age 21, grew up viewing recycling as a very lucrative activity since her family was in that business. At age 19, she completed high school and continued on to university to try to become a computer systems analyst, and she hopes to finish her degree this year. She also sells scrap metal and other recyclables, which allows her to support herself. With her income, she has also been able to pay for her university studies. Her goal is to expand this business as she is currently facing one of the biggest challenges in her life, supporting her family, especially because when her mother suffers a relapse, Cindy is the one who needs to take over her business. She is currently requesting a loan in order to increase her chances of purchasing recyclables because her business requires that she have enough money to buy and sell immediately. This is why she now turns to Kiva for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase products that are in high demand, such as cardboard, copper, and aluminum. She expects this investment to be successful as she is responding to customer demand. From her experience in her family business, Cindy knows how to manage her business well.

loans.use: to purchase products that are in high demand, such as cardboard, copper, and aluminum.

loans.name: Efrén

texts.es:
Efrén tiene 20 años, es un joven emprendedor y muy trabajador, así como decidido. Es soltero y vive en compañía de sus padres y su hermana en la casa de sus padres.
El negocio familiar es la venta de pescado. Su actividad comienza de madrugada, cuando se va a comprar con sus padres al puerto (fluvial) de su de la localidad, directamente a los pescados al por mayor; luego, en el transcurso de las horas los revenden también a precio por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados. Se inicio en éste negocio desde hace más de 3 años, contando con el apoyo de su padre. Adicionalmente, tienen una bodega en la casa de venta de comestibles de primera necesidad, la que atiende su madre, generándose otros ingresos económicos. Le gusta lo que hace, pues a parte de generar ganancias, también tiene para pagar sus estudios superiores. Al contrario, lo que no le gusta es el tener que levantarse muy temprano en la madrugada. Tiene planes de continuar en su negocio y ampliar la tienda de venta de comestibles hasta convertirse en un empresario exitoso.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, comenta sentirse agradecido por el apoyo de contar con un crédito. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio. Además dice sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la tienda de comestibles, comprando los productos en mayores volúmenes buscando menores precios.
texts.en:
Efrén, 20 years old, is a enterprising and hard-working young man, as well as dedicated. He is single and lives with his parents and sister in his parents' home. 

The family business is selling fish. Efrén's work begins in the early morning when he goes to buy fish wholesale with his parents at the river port near where he lives. Then, throughout the day, they resell the fish at a markup to the merchants of the markets. Efrén started this business 3 years ago, depending on his father's help. Additionally, they have a small grocery store at home, which sells food and basic necessities and is attended to buy Efrén's mother. This store generates additional income. Efrén likes what he does, in addition to earning income, he also has to pay for higher education. On the other hand, one aspect he doesn't like is having to get up so early in the morning. He has plans to continue with his business and expand the grocery store to turn it into a successful business. 

This is his second loan with the MFP institution. He says that he feels grateful for the support of receiving a loan. Therefore, he promises to complete the payments so he has a good credit record. He also says that he feels comfortable with his communal bank, and that he considers its members to be good people.

With the loan his is requesting, 1000 nuevo soles, he will invest in the grocery store by buying products in large volume, looking for lower prices.

loans.use: to buy more food for his store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita con su credikiva fue a la ciudad de Medellin compró ropa femenina clásica e informal y la vendió entre sus mejores clientes; con ello rotó su mercancía y aumentó ligeramente su capital de trabajo. Ahora se prepara para adquirir un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en la ciudad de Bucaramanga calzado y bolsos elaborados en los mas finos cueros,pues tiene muchos encargos y con esta inversión les responderá haciéndola así muy exitosa como la anterior. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Gracias a los fondeadores por este apoyo, que nos brindan a todos aquellos que necesitamos un respaldo económico, para salir adelante con nuestra microempresa. "
texts.en: Margarita used her previous loan to go to Medellin to buy classical and informal women’s clothes which she then sold to her best customers. Thanks to this she has varied her products and mildly increased her working capital. She is now ready to ask for another loan that she will use to go to Bucaramanga to buy shoes and bags produced with the best leather. She has receives many requests and this investment will be profitable as it will make her as successful as the first loan did. This is her message to Kiva lenders: “Thanks to the lenders for the support they provide to all of us who need an economic aid to carry on with our microenterprises”.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa, además de amable. Está separada del padre de su hijo Airton, de 10 años. Actualmente vive en compañía de sus padres, su hijo, su hermana y un sobrino, en la casa de sus padres.
Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes en general, los cuales compra en los centros de abastos de su localidad, para luego venderlos en el frontis de su vivienda, donde acondicionó una pequeña mesa y los exhibe al público durante todo el día, contando entres sus principales clientes a sus vecinos, atendiéndoles muy amablemente. Se inició hace más de 5 meses y viene realizando este negocio con la ayuda de madre en la atención al público. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite estar en casa y poder cuidar de su hijo menor, así como el ingreso económico que le genera para pagar la alimentación, vestido de su hijo y de ella misma, ya que con la pensión que le pasa su ex pareja no les alcanza. Pero ahora se siente más tranquila económicamente, e incluso tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo.

Este es su  préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por ello espera concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse tranquila y cómoda con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera buenas personas y responsables.
Con le monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en su negocio comprando abarrotes a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Ketty, 32, is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, besides being very nice.  She is separated from the father of her 10-year-old son, Airton, and she now lives with her parents, her son, her sister and a nephew in her parent’s home.
She sells groceries which she buys in the distribution centers in her area so that she can then sell the merchandise in front of her house.  She has fixed up a small table and displays the items to the public during the day, with her main customers being her neighbors and she treats them very well.  She started the business more than 5 months ago and has developed the business with her mother’s help in seeing to the customers.  She likes the work because it allows her to be home and she can care for her young son. The income that she generates pays for food, his clothing, and for herself as well since the money that her ex partner gives her isn’t enough.  For now she feels more relaxed economically and she also has plans to continue with the business and enlarge it.

This is her second loan with MFP and she hopes to fulfill her plans. 
She also says that she feels comfortable and at ease with her communal bank since she knows the members and considers them good and responsible people.
She will use the 1000 new sols requested to buy groceries at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian lives in the Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children. 

Ian used his last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. His business is successful and he is taking a new loan to pay for the labor cost in farm maintenance. 

In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in farm maintenance.

loans.name: Mirelis

texts.es: Mirelis de 27 años de edad  es la propietaria de una pequeña miscelánea, ubicada en el barrio donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 9 años. Ella terminó sus estudios de bachillerato e hizo 2 semestres de la carrera de enfermería, pero cuando quedó embarazada no pudo continuar y con el nacimiento de su primer hijo  debió dedicarse a su atención. Posteriormente decidió trabajar en un almacén durante 9 años, donde adquirió mucha experiencia y desde hace menos de tres años, impulsada por su cónyuge quien le dio su primer capital de trabajo, empezó su negocio apoyada también por el propietario de un almacén, quien le suministró mercancías, con la cual inició su miscelánea. Con su negocio genera ingresos para apoyar el bienestar  de su hogar, pues su anhelo y el de su cónyuge es ver a sus hijos en un futuro, convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado  y a crédito, Mirelis en su negocio vende ropa, calzado, accesorios femeninos artículos para el hogar entre otras mercancías. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos para damas y accesorios femeninos que tiene encargados y papelería en general, que es uno de las mercancías que debe tener entre sus inventarios pues rota rápidamente, dejándole utilidades inmediatas.
texts.en: Mirelis, age 27, is the owner of a small shop located in the same neighborhood where she lives along with her partner and 2 children, ages one and nine. She completed high school and did two semesters of a nursing degree, but was unable to finish due to her pregnancy and the birth of her first child. She later decided to work in a warehouse for 9 years, and she earned a lot of experience. Less than three years ago, propelled by both her partner, who gave her her first business capital and a warehouse owner who supplied her with merchandise, she launched her own shop. With her business, she is able to generate income to support her family's well-being since she and her partner hope to see their children grow up to become successful professionals. Mirelis accepts both cash and credit for her merchandise. She sells clothing, footwear, accessories for women, and housewares, among other products. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first, from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase ladies' dresses and accessories, which customers have ordered, and general stationery, which she must always have in stock because it quickly runs out, leaving her with immediate net profits.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' dresses, accessories, and general stationery.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married and has three children aged twelve, five, and two months. His farm produces mainly maize on a commercial scale and provides income that he uses to meet his family’s basic needs. He has been in farming for three years.

Nathan has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture into dairy farming will provide his family with milk for daily consumption as well as provide income to meet other basic needs. His focus is to run a farm of not less than seven dairy cows so as to enjoy economies of scale.

Nathan, however, points at poor weather conditions and infrastructure as the major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is from Maloro, Tangub City. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. 

Catalina used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business is successful, and she is taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de ser amable y atenta. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, que en su mayoría ya son independientes. Vive en compañía de su hija Candy de 25 años, su yerno y un nieto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas diversos sabores y marcas, también vende utensilios para la casa como ollas, platos, vasos y otros. La venta la realiza a domicilio y al crédito, atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, quienes la recomiendan con sus amistades que después se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Adicionalmente, desde hace dos años vende comida los domingos (pollos a la parrilla), lo hace para una señora que le paga por día. Le gusta su actividad, pues comenta que con eso ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, tanto en su educación como en su alimentación y demás gastos. Gracias a la buena acogida que tiene su negocio y las ganancias extra, no ha tenido apuros económicos. Ahora desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo empezando a vender golosinas.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Desea seguir contando con ese apoyo, por eso cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas. Además, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra, a precio por mayor, de las bebidas gaseosas, golosinas y mercadería variada que ofrece.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old. She's a hardworking and enterprising woman, and she's also friendly and attentive. She's separated from the father of her children, most of whom are independent. She lives with her 25-year-old daughter Candy, her son-in-law and a grandson.
She sells various beverages of different flavors and brands. She also sells home utensils such as pots, plates, glasses and other items. She sells them door-to-door and on credit. She treats her customers very cordially, and they recommend her to their friends, who then become her regular customers. In addition, she has been selling food (grilled chicken) every Sunday for the past two years. She does this for a lady who pays her for each day of work. She enjoys her business, because she reports that with it she has succeeded in getting her children ahead in terms of education, food and other expenses. Thanks to how well-received her business is and the extra profits she makes, she hasn't had financial trouble. She currently wishes to keep her business going and to expand it by starting to sell candy.
This is her second loan with MFP. She's thankful for the financial support in order to move forward with her business. She wishes to keep counting on this support, which is why she will comply with her repayments. Furthermore, she says that she feels good in her communal bank, because she considers the members to be good people.
With the requested loan of 1.000 nuevos soles she will purchase soft drinks, candy and the various merchandise she offers, all at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, candy and utensils for selling.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is aged thirty-five years and runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He produces maize, milk, and poultry products to sell to the local market. He has been in commercial farming for six years.

Geoffrey has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to improve his poultry business by buying more poultry birds. He is focusing on expanding his farming business significantly to be able to earn enough income to meet his growing family’s needs, especially the education of his children.

Geoffrey says animal diseases and the high costs of inputs remain the greatest limitations.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Indira

texts.es: Indira  de 44 años es la propietaria de un negocio donde se preparan y se venden comidas rápidas, con diferentes características. Ella inicialmente vivía en otro municipio del departamento del Atlántico y tenia una tienda de víveres. Posteriormente cuando realizó un curso de culinaria, decidió cambiar de actividad y dedicarse a la preparación y venta de alimentos;   inicialmente impactó el mercado con productos fritos de consumo usual de las familias. Posteriormente cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, se dedicó a la venta de comidas rápidas. Hoy sueña con tener su propio local confortable, donde el cliente encuentre todas las delicias de comidas, que ella sabe técnicamente preparar y al que les agrega mucho amor. Con su negocio apoya la gestión de bienestar de su hogar en el cual existen  2 hijos, en las edades de 16 y 25 años;  con ellos que sueña verlos convertidos en personas de mucho éxito y son el motor de su vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos y poder ofrecer precios competitivos a sus clientes. Con esta estrategia que le aporta su credikiva se prepara para tener como resultado una inversión exitosa, con la que aspira a incrementar el número de sus clientes y con ello lograr ganar un poco mas de dinero para fortalecer especialmente el bienestar de sus nietos, a quienes tiene a su cargo después del fallecimiento de su hija, quien fuera madre de ellos.
texts.en: Indira is 44 years old and owner of a fast food restaurant. In the beginning, she lived in another municipal in Atlantic department and had a grocery store. Later, after she finished her cooking classes, she decided to change jobs and dedicate her time to prepare and sell meals. She had an impact with the market with fried foods usually ordered by families. After, she arrived to the city of Barranquilla she began to sell fast food. Today, she dreams of owning her own comfortable locale, where clients can find all of the delicious meal she knows how to prepare with love. With her job she is able to provide for her family’s well-being. Her family consists of two children ages 18 and 25. She dreams of seeing them turn into successful people and they are her drive for life. At the moment she is requesting her first loan with Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to buy wholesale products to get discounts and offer competitive prices to her clients. This will help her have a substantial raise in profits and have more clients so she can make more money to support her family, specifically her grandchildren ever since her daughter died and she is in charge of them.

loans.use: buy wholesale products to prepare meals

loans.name: Osval

texts.es: Osval de 34 años de edad, tiene un taller donde presta el servicio de embobinar motores de vehículos. Su idea de negocio inició, cuando trabajando como empleado de una empresa dedicada  a ofrecer este servicio, quedó discapacitado después de un accidente, desafío que debió enfrentar con decisión, amor propio y valentía, por eso decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios. Así fue que acudió a su experiencia para ponerla al servicio de la comunidad y ofrecer otros servicios adicionales, dedicándose así a embobinar motocicletas, hacer mantenimiento de lavadoras, de hornos microondas, actividades que realiza a domicilio o en su pequeño taller instalado en el lugar donde habita. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y muy confortable. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para abastecerse de repuestos que requiere para realizar los servicios que ofrece. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el que comprará materiales para embobinar, como alambre, alambres, bujías, tarjetas electrónicas y otros repuestos, que garantizarán un trabajo mas efectivo, lo cual  es justamente la respuesta, que siempre esperan sus clientes y que Osval necesita darla, pues ellos son la razón de ser de su negocio, con  él cual él gana dinero para su propio sustento.
texts.en:
Osval is 34 years old and has a small shop in his home where he repairs car and motorcycle engines.  He got the idea for this business when he became disabled following an accident while working as an employee for another business performing this type of work.  He has faced this challenge decisively, with love and courage; these attributes led him start his own business venture.

This is how he came to offer his services to the community. He also offers other services, such as repairing washing machines and microwave ovens; he does these things out of the small shop in his home.  His goal is to have a larger, more comfortable shop of his own.  Currently, his greatest challenge is having enough working capital to stock his shop with all the parts he needs in order to do his job.

This is his reason for seeking a Kiva loan, which will be his first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loan proceeds he will purchase materials such as wire, spark plugs, circuit boards and other spare parts so that he can perform his work more effectively.  This is what Osval's customers want, and what he needs to give them, since they are the reason his business exists. This business is what allows him to support himself financially.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wire, spark plugs, circuit boards and other spare parts.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a resident of Kitale where he has been actively farming for six consecutive years.  He is married and has one young child who is not yet two years old.  His farm currently sells his produce, which includes maize, milk and other horticultural products, to the local market.

Jared has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says this will improve his milk output and increase his farming income to meet family basic needs.  He hopes to double his farming output within five years.

Jared says unreliable rains, high costs of production and fluctuations in market prices are the leading challenges he faces.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is married and has six children.  She is 54 years old and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.   

Elpedia owns a plot of farmland, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living.   She has been in this business for six years and earns 7,000 PHP each month.  She has requested a loan of 7,600 PHP in order to purchase chemicals to use on her farm.  Elpedia has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2009.   

In the future, Elpedia hopes to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to use on her farm.

loans.name: El Milagro 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  El Milagro 1 está conformado por diez personas, humildes, originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Tututepec San Pedro  donde una de sus tradiciones es la fiesta de pueblo que se celebra los días 12 y 13 de octubre donde van los niños de los pueblos vecinos a representar los bailes de su región.
Una de las representantes de este grupo es la señora Faustina Jovita de ochenta años de edad. 
Doña  Jovita  como mejor la conocen sus paisanos dice que lo que mas le gusta de su región es el orgullo y las fuerzas de la gente mixteca.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes como son galletas, cereales, detergente, aceite, refrescos, café, azúcar, jugos, pan, yogurt y verduras.
También se dedica a la venta de ropa, maiz desde hace treinta años  lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender con amabilidad a sus clientas, ya que son ellos son sus mas grandes amigos.
Dice que una de las cosas más lindas que le han pasado es contar con la ayuda de fundacion ya que con su ayuda va a comprar más ropa, maiz y mercancía de abarrotes para la venta por menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las mujeres sin importar su edad y sus raíces.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Victoria-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Gloria-quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
María Dolores-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Tomasa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Catalina-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosa Elia -quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Silvia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Quirino-se dedica a la venta de frutas y semillas.
Eustolia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente humilde y trabajadora con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called "El Milagro 1" (The Miracle 1) and consists of 10 humble individuals who are originally from a small town called Tututepec San Pedro. One of the traditions here is the town festival celebrated on October 12 and 13, where the children from the neighboring towns represent the dances of the their region.

One of the representatives for this group is Sra. Faustina Jovita, who is 80 years old. Doña Jovita, as is she is better known among her fellow townspeople, says that what she likes most about her region is the pride and strength of the Mixtec people. She says that she sells grocery products such as cookies, grains, detergent, oil, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, juices, bread, yogurt, and vegetables. Jovita has also been selling clothes and corn for 30 years. What she enjoys most about her business is serving her customers with great kindness. Many of them have become her greatest friends. Doña Jovita says that one of the nicest things that has happened to her is receiving assistance from Fundación Realidad that allows her to buy more clothing, corn, and grocery products that she can sell at retail. She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping all women without regard to age or race.

The other group members are as follows: • Victoria sells fish. • Gloria sells food. • María Dolores sells fish. • Tomasa sells clothes. • Catalina sells Mexican street food. • Rosa Elia sells groceries. • Silvia sells Mexican street food. • Quirino sells fruits and seeds. • Eustolia sells Mexican street food. They are grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping humble and hardworking people who want to excel.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, clothing, and corn to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo conoce muy bien las fechas especiales en las cuales en su negocio se incrementan las ventas; pero también sabe que solamente si tiene  su negocio bien surtido le va muy bien y gana dinero. Él es un experto en el tema comercial y aprovechando su potencial personal y de  mercado,  creó un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancías variadas tipo miscelánea, donde sus clientes compran de todo un poco, porque en sus exhibidores hay papelería, útiles escolares, accesorios, pasabocas y   también encuentran servicio de   fotocopiaje y de llamadas a celulares. Eduardo va agregando poco a poco lo que su clientela necesita y él no tiene y así ha garantizado el éxito de sus inversiones, desde el momento en que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, compró su casa propia y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios pues tenia ya la experiencia adquirida en su tierra natal traída desde el municipio de Cereté, ubicado en Córdoba una de las regiones mas ganaderas de Colombia. Eduardo está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde hace un año, allí recibió su primer financiamiento y con él ha logrado aumentar ligeramente su capital de trabajo y espera poco a poco, lograr mayores éxitos reflejado en sus ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará artículos de papelería, pasabocas, planes de celulares, detalles femeninos, con los que impactará en las fechas especiales que se acercan y que son  temporadas en las cuales los comerciantes deben hacer la mayor inversión de capital,  porque las familias reciben pagos por vacaciones, bonificaciones y primas de trabajo, que disponen usualmente para la compra de estos artículos de consumo.
texts.en:
Eduardo knows very well the special dates when his business sales go up; but also he knows that only if he has a well stocked store will he do well and earn money. He is an expert on trade and is taking advantage of his personal potential and of the market. He created an intervening business which sells a variety of miscellaneous kinds of goods, where his clients buy a little of everything, because his display cases contain stationery, school supplies, accessories, snacks and also they find photocopy services and cell phone service. 

Eduardo is adding, little by little, what his customers need that he does not have and has guaranteed the success of his investments, from the moment he arrived in the city of Barranquilla. He bought his own house and began his own business venture as he already had experience acquired in his birthplace in the town of Cereté, located in Córdoba, one of the livestock areas of Colombia.

Eduardo has been associated with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from a year ago, and received there his first loan with which he managed to slightly increase his cash flow and he expects to little by little achieve better success reflected in his profits.

Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy stationery, snacks, cell phone plans, and feminine accessories, which will have an impact on special dates that are approaching that are seasonal when the merchants should make the largest investment of capital because families receive vacation pay, bonuses and allowances, that they usually use to buy these commodities.

loans.use: to buy stationery, snacks, cell phone plans, and feminine accessories

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en: Ponciana is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 62 years old. Ponciana is married and has two children. Ponciana used her last loan to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and thread. Her business has become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc.

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza de 28 años, vive con su hijo de 5 años de edad, en el municipio de Soledad, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica a la oferta de servicios de mejoramiento de imagen personal, que presta a domicilio en esta comunidad. Así mismo asesora a su clientela en ese tema y les vende productos de belleza, de acuerdo a las características del tratamiento. Sus principales productos son cosméticos, shampoos, tratamientos capilares y pinta uñas. Ella también ofrece artículos a través de guías especializadas de productos, pues está afiliada a una empresa que enfoca sus productos en la cosmetología y a la belleza física. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en la principal distribuidora de productos cosméticos y de belleza, para en un futuro asegurar la educación exitosa de su hijo, motor principal de su vida y por quien trabaja con mucho esmero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza, cosméticos en general e  implementos para la prestación del servicio de belleza. Su inversión será exitosa, porque la hace en el marco de pedidos de sus rentables clientes y con el dinero en sus manos podrá comprar mercancías, que traen descuentos y en mayor cantidad, lo cual generará ingresos superiores a los acostumbrados y precios muy competitivos, que benefician a su clientela,   razón de ser de su negocio.
texts.en: 28-year-old Esperanza lives with her 5-year-old son in the town of Soledad, very close to the city of Barranquilla. There she offers personal appearance improving services, which she provides on a door-to-door basis in this community. At the same time, she advises her customers on this subject and sells them beauty products according to the characteristics of the treatment. Her main products are cosmetics, shampoos, hair treatments and nail polish. She also offers merchandise from specialized product directories, because she's affiliated with a company that focuses its products on cosmetology and physical beauty. Her goal is to expand her business and to become the top distributor of cosmetics and beauty products, so that in the future she can ensure a successful education for her son. Her son is the main driving force in her life and the reason why she works very hard. She currently requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase beauty products, cosmetics in general and supplies for providing her beauty services. Her investment will be successful, because it's done in connection to the orders from her profitable customers. Also, with money on hand, she will be able to purchase merchandise on discount and in bulk, and this will result in higher profits than usual and in very competitive prices which benefit her customers, the raison d'être for her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, cosmetics in general and supplies for providing her beauty services.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a resident of Kitale. He is a farmer with ten years of experience. He currently sells his farm produce of maize, beans, and milk to the local market. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He gets some additional income from his land surveying services. He is married with four children who are all school-going.

Enock has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a cow to boost his dairy farming business. He states that the dairy farming business has better returns, and he wants to make it his core farming business by increasing the number of his cows to six within five years. He adds he will use the income in meeting his family's basic needs, especially with educating his children. 

He notes poor weather conditions and roads networks as the main hindrances to his farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Savziali

texts.ru: Савзиали добрый семьянин, он женат и вместе с женой воспитывает пятерых детей, двух дочерей и трех сыновей. Его жена помогает мужу в содержании семьи, Она решила работать в дехканском хозяйстве. Более 2-х лет Савзиали занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. В основном он выращивает дыню, арбуз, помидоры и другие сельхозпродукты. А также выращивает хлопок на продажу и получает хорошую прибыль. Савзиали запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Savziali is a good family man.  Together with his wife, he raises five children: two daughters and three sons.  His wife has taken a job at an orchard and therefore helps him to provide for the family.

Savziali has been growing and selling agricultural products for more than two years.  He mostly grows melons, watermelons, tomatoes and other crops.  He also cultivates and sells cotton and gets good profits.

He is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants. He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando está muy contento con la inversión que hizo con su anterior credikiva, pues por cuenta de ella pudo comprar 4 lavadoras y ahora gana un poco mas de dinero y pagó siempre su crédito puntualmente. Ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará 2 lavadoras y muebles para ir fortaleciendo su otro negocio, pues muchos son los encargos de escaparates, multimueble y mesas. El pide a  los financiadores de Kiva  que sigan haciendo esta hermosa labor;  Así todos estamos de acuerdo  en que mucho contribuye en el mejoramiento de la comunidad de microempresas, porque impacta positivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Hernando is very happy with the investment he made with the previous Kiva loan because he could buy four washing machines and how earns a little more money and always makes his payments on time. 

Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan with which he will buy two washing machines and furniture in order to strengthen his other business, because there are many orders from the display windows, cabinets, and tables. He is asking the Kiva funders to continue this beautiful work, as we all agree that they contribute greatly to the betterment of the community of micro-businesses, positively impacting their earnings.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines and furniture in order to strengthen his other business, because there are many orders from the display windows, cabinets, and tables

loans.name: Mayan

texts.en:
Mayan is 25 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a food store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith who produces axes and knives to sell. He earns about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Mayan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase steel for her husband to produce more axes and knives to sell. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, Mayan would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new concrete house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase steel for her husband to produce more axes and knives to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad vive en San Juan Nepomuceno con su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de menor de un año de edad. Allí se dedica al negocio de vender ropa y bolsos especialmente, a una clientela que ha construido poco y que permanece en crecimiento. Ella inició esta actividad para lograr obtener ingresos y responder a sus gastos personales, pues su esposo tiene una tienda y sustenta la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar; los productos  que vende María en la población, se los envían desde la capital de Colombia, Bogotá, donde hay una gran variedad de diseños, modas y especificaciones, que gustan a su clientela con característica de exclusividad. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen ropa interior, bolsos a la moda, pues ha hecho una preventa y tiene encargados una gran cantidad, que no puede comprar con su propio capital, porque gran parte de el, se encuentra en sus cuentas por cobrar y para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, deberá responder rápidamente, porque ellos no resisten esperar para ser fieles y el atenderlos dará como resultado aumentar su credibilidad y esto es lo que persigue Maria.
texts.en: 42-year-old María lives in San Juan Nepomuceno with her family, which is comprised of her spouse and her son, who's under a year old. There she sells mainly clothing and bags to a small clientele that she has built and that is still growing. She started this business in order to get an income and to be able to afford her personal expenses, since her husband owns a store and pays for most of their home expenses. The products María sells in her town are sent from the Colombian capital of Bogotá, where there's a large variety of designs, fashions and specific items which please her customers because of their exclusive look. She currently requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will purchase underwear and trendy bags in bulk. She has made pre-sales and has a great amount of orders, which she can't meet with her own capital, because a big part of it is in the payments she has yet to collect. In order to keep her customers satisfied, she must respond promptly, because they won't withstand the wait and remain faithful. By serving her customers well, as a result she will enhance her credibility, and that's what María strives for.

loans.use: to purchase underwear and trendy bags in bulk.

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.es: Jacquelin de 50 años de edad se dedica al comercio de artículos variados, como ropa, calzado, bolsos y fantasía en general, los cuales distribuye a crédito y algunas veces de contado entre su clientela, que ha ido construyendo poco a poco. Jacquelin  trabajó anteriormente como empleada y al mismo tiempo inició su aventura comercial en sus momentos libres; pero como su clientela creció y aumentó la demanda de sus productos, el tiempo no resultaba suficiente para hacer su negocio y con el todas las actividades de inversión, estudio de proveedores, ventas, recuperación de su cartera etc. Así fue como decidió dejar de ser empleada para dedicarse exclusivamente al comercio. Su mercado está conformado por empleados de empresas, vecinas del barrio, familiares y referidos de estos mismos; gradualmente es muy amplia la demanda de productos a crédito y a Jacquelin  le queda difícil responderle de manera oportuna, pues primero debe recuperar lo invertido y una vez con el dinero en la mano, responder a los pedidos de sus clientes. Tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para ser efectiva en su negocio, se ha convertido en su gran desafío, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará billeteras, bolsos, correas y sabanas, que son los artículos que rotan con mayor facilidad y han solicitado sus potenciales compradores.
