María Elena Vive en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, Es Casada tiene 3 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente en su propio negocio, el cual consiste en una pequeña pulpería y Venta de calzados de diferente estilos en su propia casa de habitación,  por primera vez está solicitando crédito con nuestra institución, donde ella se logró a informar a través de promoción por el personal de Ceprodel que ayudaba a este tipo de actividad.

El destino del crédito Solicitado es para darle un mejor surtido a su negocio, comprando producto varias y calzado donde esto le permitirá obtener mejor ganancia diaria y sus ventas sean con una mejor Productividad. 
 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She is married and has three dependent children. María Elena currently has a business in her home that consists of a small grocery store and a shop where she sells different styles of shoes.

She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for the first time. María Elena learned about the loans at a promotional event conducted by the CEPRODEL staff, which explained how the loans could help her with this type of business activity. The loan she requested will be used to better stock her business. She will buy various products and shoes so that she can generate more daily revenue and become more productive with her sales. This will allow María Elena to maintain better conditions for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy various products and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing  business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. He is from Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, where his corn production is located. He was just 25 years old when he started cultivating this land. At the end of the month, Joel gets PHP 8,000, which he equally divides with his family. In 2011, Joel joined GDMPC. He has borrowed PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time. Joel plans to apply appropriate fertilizers and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sokchiv

texts.en:
Sokchiv (pictured here), age 35, has a business as a food vender. She runs the business at home. Her husband, Mea Nop, age 42, assists his wife in the business. The couple lives about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four children--two sons and two daughters. All of their children attend school.  

Sokchiv is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to expand her food vendor business by buying additional materials such as chairs, plates, forks, spoons and so on. She will also use a part of the loan to add to her house where she operates her business.

loans.use: To expand her food vendor business by buying additional materials such as chairs, plates, forks, spoons and so on.

loans.name: Layen

texts.en:
Layen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling oysters in the Philippines. Layen has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.  She has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Layen would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (pictured here), 47, is a widow with four sons and two daughters. One of her children is married, two are garment workers, two are soldiers, and another one is attending primary school. The family lives in a village about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Touch sells mangoes. She buys them under contract from villagers from the blooming to harvesting season. She needs to use pesticides to protect mangoes from insects. Additionally, she also raises pigs at home. 

Touch hopes to expand her business by buying more mangoes for resale, so she decided to apply for a loan to help her capital. She will also use a part of the loan to buy pesticides to protect mangoes from insects.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes under contract for resale and to buy pesticides to protect them from insects.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул–участница группы «Азамат». Бактыгул 52 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Бактыгул 20 лет назад начала   заниматся животноводством.  Имея в хозяйстве 1 дойную корову и 1 лошадь, Бактыгул имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Baktygul is a member of the "Azamat" group. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children. 

She became involved in animal husbandry 20 years ago, providing her family with its main source of income.  She owns one dairy cow and one horse, and makes a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  

She will use her loan to buy sheep. 

Baktygul plans to invest her earnings into further increasing her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Tolkun

texts.ru: Толкун –участница группы «Азамат». Толкун 31 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Толкун занимается животноводством, стартовав с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS).  Имея в хозяйстве 2 дойных коров,  27 овец, Толкун имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толкун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Толкун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Tolkun is a member of the "Azamat" group. She is 31 years old, married, and is bringing up three children.

Tolkun provides a source of income for her family working in animal husbandry, a business she started with an initial amount of 15,000 som (KGS). She owns two dairy cows and 27 head of sheep, and makes a monthly profit of 8,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk.

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).

She will use her loan to buy additional livestock.

She plans to invest her earnings into further increasing her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pc1 Mbour Toucouleur Group

texts.fr:
le Banc Villageois a été créé depuis le 02/09/2008.
il est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et pratiquent le même activité.
Elle son unies par des liens sociaux .
Madame Fatoumata est une femme marié age de 42 ans et mère de 5 garçons.Elle fait du commerce de fruits depuis quelques années. elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
son nouveau crédit de 110000F lui permettra de ce procurer de la marchandise (mangues orange et mandarine)
 les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront d’assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants(nourriture scolarisation et santé)
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on 2 September 2008, and its members are women who live in the same neighborhood and have the same business. They are all related by social links.

Fatoumata is 42 years of age, married and the mother of five sons. She has sold fruit for several years, and has good experience in this area.

The new loan of 110,000 francs that she has requested will allow her to buy merchandise (mangos, oranges and mandarins). The profit generated by her business will allow her to cover her needs and those of her children (food, education and health).

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle vend des mèches et des parfums. Elle consacre 10 heures de temps de la journée à son activité. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé 5 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 225 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de mèches, de parfums et autres accessoires pour femmes. Son plus grand  rêve  dans le futur est de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Astou is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has worked selling products in her sector for 10 years. She sells hair extensions and perfumes, and spends 10 hours a day at her business. 

Astou is the member of a U-IMCEC branch, and has already repaid her five previous loans. She has requested a loan of 225,000 francs to buy hair extensions, perfumes and other women’s accessories. Her biggest dream for the future is to become a successful saleswoman.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, perfumes and women’s accessories for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou vit au Sénégal et capitalise une expérience de 30 ans dans le commerce et la vente de produits halieutiques (poissons séchés, huitres, etc.). Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  localisé dans sa zone d’habitation. Elle consacre 8 heures de temps de la journée à son activité  de commerce. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. L’objectif du prêt consiste a acheter des produits halieutiques qui seront destinés a la vente pour les besoins d son commerce. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, développer son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir soutenir ses enfants dans le règlement des frais scolaires et aussi épargner de l’argent pour les besoins futurs.
texts.en:
Fatou lives in Senegal and has 30 years’ experience in the sale of fish products (dried fish, oysters, etc.). She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch located in the area where she lives. She spends eight hours per day working. 

Fatou is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and has requested a loan of 500,000 francs. She will use this loan to buy fish products for sale through her business. She wants to increase her capital, develop her business and increase her profit. This will enable her to support her children by paying their school fees, as well as saving money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy fish products for sale.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: El socio Jhon nació en la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Lucre de la provincia del Cusco, él tiene 42 años de edad y está casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. El socio Jhon tiene diferentes tipos de actividades como por ejemplo es albañil y es panadero, él tiene un horno que esta implementado con las necesidades basicas pero el local es alquilado. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a la venta y elaboración de panes. En esta oportunidad Jhon requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más.  El sueño del  socio  Jhon es comprarse un terreno para construir su propio horno. El socio Jhon pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Jhon was born in the province of Manu in the department of Madre de Dios but he presently lives in the city of Lucre in the province of Cusco. He is 42 years old and is married. From this beautiful relationship he has three children. Jhon carries out various types of business activities. For example, he is a bricklayer and a baker; he has a bakery which is equipped with the basic implements although the shop is rented. He has made a living making and selling breads for the past seven years.

On this occasion Jhon is requesting a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, butter and other items. Jhon's dream is to buy a plot of land to build his own bakery. Jhon belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre", part of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, butter and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale stock for her business, such as chuño.

loans.name: Ma. Rosabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Rosabelle is married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Rosabelle is forty-two years old.

Ma. Rosabelle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Rosabelle requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Rosabelle has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Rosabelle would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zibola

texts.en:
Zibola is a resident of Kitale and has been in farming for twenty-one solid years. She is married with eight children, all adults. Her farm produces maize, milk and poultry for the local market.

Zibola has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds to boost her farming business. She says an improved farming income will make her more self-reliant and more secure financially for her old age days because she will have savings. 

She laments the high cost of inputs and rampant animal diseases. She remains however grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services available to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sien

texts.en:
Sien is forty-two years old and her husband Chhan is forty-seven years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and they have five children: one son and four daughters. One is married and lives separately, another one is a garment worker and the others are attending school. 

Sien sells recycling materials, while her husband produces jar-covers, made of cement, for sale. Sien is applying for her first Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle for her son who is a garment worker to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Veronica bought sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions as well as fresh vegetables, that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because her established clientele has requested more products, and Veronica's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful: because she will respond to demand by buying fruits and vegetables from the harvest, at a good price and above all very fresh. Veronica would like to tell the people who lend her money that her Kiva loans have been very useful for her. She says thank you, and hopes that they will continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of other family members (her brother and sister). Specioza does poultry farming from her home. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from a hardware shop. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

Specioza has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks. Her major business challenge is transporting chicken feed and ever increasing costs of chicken feed. Her dream is to expand her business in order to own 2,000 laying chickens. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Mwange Group

texts.fr:
Cyriaque  fait partie du groupe  Mwange et  habite à  Rumonge, une commune sous la supervision de la branche de Bujumbura. Il  a  33 ans et est marié à Dévote, commerçante de légume. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés  de 3 semaines  à 5 ans.

Il fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis 18 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bidons d’huile de palme à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle , des terres cultivables et voir ses enfants poursuivre et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Cyriaque is part of the Mwange group and lives in Rumonge, a community belonging to the Bujumbura district. He is 33 years old and is married to Devote, who is a trader of vegetables. Together they have three children, aged 3 weeks to 5 years.

He has been trading palm oil for the past 18 years.

This is his first credit loan with Turame. With the loan obtained from Kiva he will increase his working capital and buy lots of cans of palm oil for resale, so as to earn more.

In coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land, some farmland, and see his children pursue and complete their studies.

loans.use: Increase his working capital, buy lots of cans of palm oil for sale, and earn more.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es: Jose Feliz casado con dos hijos mayores de edad este emprendedor presta su servicio de odontologia desde hace treinta y cinco años el cual cuenta con mucha experiencia, en la actualidad el ha incretamenta su clienta devido al buen servicio que presta en su comunidad, el necesita invetir el dinero en capital de trabajo para comprar material de trabajo como : Pinzas, anestecio topico, subcionadores de saliba, jeringa para anestecia, gasas. Algodón.
texts.en: Jose Feliz is married and has two grown children. This entrepreneur has offered his odontological services for thirty five years, so he has a lot of experience. Now he has increased his number of patients because of the good service that he offers the community. He needs to invest the money in working capital to buy materials such as: tweezers, topical anesthetic, saliva suction devices, anesthetic syringes and cotton.

loans.use: to buy: tweezers, topical anesthetic, a saliva suction devices, anesthetic syringes and gauze.

loans.name: Despertar  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Despertar está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gran belleza natural y cultural hacen de esta ciudad encantadora, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable y de un corazón muy cálido. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Janneth,  tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo una grúa, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Janneth se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, actividad que la desarrolla hace 13 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, le gusta mucho este trabajo ya que le da la oportunidad de pasar en casa al cuidado de su familia. 

Nuestra socia se encuentra reingresando a la banca comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de una socias que por metivos de su trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Despertar communal bank is made up of 10 women and one man who work in different activities. These allow them to pay for their household expenses and get their families ahead. They are friendly, kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They live in different areas in the city of Cuenca, a city bathes by 4 rivers. Its great beauty and nature make this city charming and the variety of its cuisine captivates its own people and visitors. Its people are kind and warmhearted.

One of the members of this group is Janneth. She is 32 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has 2 children, aged 11 and 2. Her oldest goes to a local school. Her husband is a driver and works as a crane operator. They don't own their own home and are renters. 
 
Janneth sells cosmetics. She has been doing this for 13 years. She works Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule. She really likes the work, since it gives her a chance to stay at home and take care of her family.   

Janneth is re-entering the communal bank and she is going to invest the new loan in buying cosmetics to increase her merchandise. Her dream is to own her own home.  

The small photo is of one of the members who due to work couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La socia Salome nació en la distrito de Lucre  de la provincia de Lucre del departamento del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 70 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos. La socia Salome se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. La socia Salome pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Salome was born in the Lucre district of the province of Lucre, region of Cusco, and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 70 years old, a widow, and has six children. Salome bakes and sells bread. She asks for this loan to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour and sugar, butter, and others. Salome is a member of communal bank "Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre" that works with field partner Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour and sugar, butter, and others.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia Alejandrina nació en la distrito de Lucre  de la provincia de Lucre del departamento del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.  La socia Alejandrina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. La socia Alejandrina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar, manteca y otras cosas más. La socia Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Alejandrina was born in the Lucre district of the province of Lucre, region of Cusco, and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 40 years old and married; her happy union was blessed with three children. Alejandrina has been baking and selling bread for 20 years. Her business is going well thanks to her hard work. She asks for this loan to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour and sugar, butter, and others. Alejandrina is a member of communal bank "Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre" that works with field partner Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour and sugar, butter, and others.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y radica junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Mochumí. Pertenece a la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría animales menores como aves, cerdos y ovejas en corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando ellos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrera en los campos de sembrío cercanos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales, alimento balanceado y arreglando sus corrales, de este modo sus animales se desarrollarán de mejor manera y podrán ser vendidos a mejores precios. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y entregada a su familia, las personas que le conocen le estiman mucho y le tienen mucho cariño.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her family in one of the communities that makes up the rural farming district of Mochumí. It belongs to the Lambayeque region.

She raises and sells small animals such as birds, pigs and sheep in pens set up in the back of her house. She feed them natural grains and grasses. When they have reached a good stage of development she sells them to the merchants who frequently visit the area. In addition, she works as a laborer in the fields of nearby crops. With the income she makes from these activities she helps her husband with the family support.

María wants to grow her business by acquiring more animals and balanced feed, and by fixing her pens. This way her animals will develop better and be able to sell at a lower price. To achieve her goal she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

She is a very active woman and very dedicated to her family. People who know her respect her a lot and like her very much.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed and to improventhe pens so she can expand her animal raising business and sales.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por 14 socias, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar sus gastos y aportar a la economía de sus hogares, se caracterizan por ser mujeres amables y muy gentiles que luchan el día a día, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene clima frió, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una gran riqueza natural y cultural, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Norma, vive por el sector de la Mutualista Azuay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Norma hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y varios productos de belleza, les vende a sus amigas de la universidad, ya que estudia nutrición y dietética y cursa el último año de su carrera universitaria.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  graduarse y ser una buena profesional.

Las dos fotos peqaueñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" is formed by 14 members who work in different business activities. These activities allow them to pay their bills and contribute to the home economies. They are known to be kind, friendly women who fight day in day out, and follow the culture and traditions of their villages. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and has been part of the World Cultural Heritage since 1999. It has great natural and cultural wealth, its cuisine if very varied and captivates the palate of natives and visitors alike.

One of the members of the group is Norma. She lives in the Mutualista Azuay sector in the city of Cuenca. She is 36 years old, married and from this relationship has two children, aged 17 and 9. Her oldest child is studying at college and her youngest studies in a school in the city. Her husband works as a public employee. The house where they live is their own property.

Norma has made a living for the last two years selling cosmetics and various beauty products. She sells to her friends from university, as she is studying nutrition and diet and is in her last year of this university degree.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and will invest her loan in buying cosmetics to increase her stock.

Her goal is to graduate and be a good professional. 

The two small photos are of three members who could no be present for the group photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Esther;La socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria ella vende  a sus amistades ,familiares y vecinos,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderia como colonias y cremas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS"; The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Esther, who continues with her business buying and selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, and other items. The member works as a street vendor. She sells to her friends, family members and neighbours. She has made a living in this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to her hard work. The member is an earnest, responsible person with a great desire to get her family ahead.

The member requests a loan to buy stock such as perfumes and creams.

The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and she is committed to paying her loan payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy stock such as perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Doña Elsa sigue invirtiendo en su pulperia, contando con el apoyo economico de su esposo, el cual labora en taxi, tras varios credito ha logrado el aumento de inventario en productos, la captacion de mas clientes, asi como cubrir sus gastos personales.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento invertira, en granos basicos, productos lacteos, coca cola, golosinas, productos de uso personal, y otros de los cuales son mas consumido por los clientes.
texts.en: Elsa keeps investing in her convenience store, thanks in part to the economic support of her husband, who is a cab driver. After several loans, she managed to increase her product stock, draw more customers, and cover personal expenses. Today, with this new loan, she seeks to buy more of the products that are in high customer demand: basic grains, dairy products, Coca-Cola, sweets, personal use products, etc.

loans.use: buy various products to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Mario

texts.es: Sergio Mario de la localidad de chinandega, casado con dos hijos mayores de edad, el tiene por actividad economica la venta de reposteria ubica en su casa de habitacion y de forma ambulante  tine 12 años   realizadon dicha actividad, el objectivo del prestamos es mayor capital para invertir en la ofertas  y obtener mas ganancias  y de esa forma darle mejores condiciones  economica a mi familia , el financiamiento lo invertira para la produccion de empanadas, picos, tortas, pudin, cachos, trensa, pan simple entre otros.
texts.en: Sergio Mario is from Chinandega, married, and has two adult children. He sells baked goods from his home as well as door-to-door. He has been in this business for 12 years. The aim of this loan is to have more capital to invest in order to offer more products and earn more money. He wants to improve his family's standard of living. He will invest this loan towards making empanadas, shortbread, pies, puddings, croissants, braided bread, plain bread, and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya se encuentran independizados. La localidad donde reside es el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona agrícola que se encuentra a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque.

Cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar labores de transporte), sus vehículos dan servicio de transporte en la zona y los alrededores. Ella cuenta con más de once años de experiencia en el rubro. En la zona donde reside, estos vehículos se presentan como una buena alternativa de transporte por lo que la demanda es bastante alta.

Guillermina desea adquirir una mototaxi usada para incrementar su flota y así percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y emprendedora. Guillermina agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada por los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en: Guillermina is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband: her children already live independently. She lives in Nueva Arica district, an agricultural zone located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region. She has two auto rickshaws (vehicles that consist of a cabin attached to a motor scooter and that are used to transport passengers), which she uses to provide transportation in her district and the neighbouring areas. She has over 11 years of experience in this business. In the area where she lives, these vehicles are a popular choice for transportation, which means that demand is quite high. Guillermina wishes to buy a used auto rickshaw to increase her fleet and thus earn more money, and thus asked field partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 new soles that will help her attain this goal. She is a rather hardworking and dedicated woman. Guillermina thanks Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy a used auto rickshaw to expand her transportation business.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive por  los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, su situación geográfica es muy accidentada y nos brinda hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 74 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija quien es soltera y vive de manera independiente, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María pasa el mayor de su tiempo en casa, por lo que se dedica a la cría de  cerdos, pollos, borregos y ganado a los mismos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También se dedica a la agricultura y sus  productos son para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y borregos.

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nueva Amistad cooperative bank, and lives in the surroundings of the Cumbe en Cuenca parish.  The climate there is cold, the terrain is very hilly, and it provides beautiful landscapes to enjoy nature.  Its people dedicate themselves to raising animals and farming, and still retain the culture and tradition of their towns.

María is 74 years old and a widow; in her marriage, she had one daughter who is single and lives independently.  She owns the house that she lives in.

María spends the majority of her time at home, given that she dedicates herself to raising pigs, chickens, sheep and livestock that she sells only when she has a financial need.  She also works at farming, and her products are for both using at home and to offer for sale.

She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 5 years, and she is going to invest her loan into the purchase of pigs, chickens and sheep.  Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens and sheep.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en:
Valijon is engaged in a business selling men’s clothes. He is single, not yet married, and started his business of retailing of men’s shoes in 2000. He had a small place of trade, and little by little expanded his business. He opened a new trade place in the central market and also added men’s clothes for sale. He purchases his merchandise from Turkey. 

Valijon would like to get a loan for the purchase of new merchandise in order to expand his business. Valijon hopes to receive your help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal merchandise to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 46 años de edad, casado y padre de 5 hijos en las edades de 8 a 25 años, es el propietario de un taller de confecciones desde hace 15 años,  donde produce ropa en las líneas femenina, masculina e infantil; así mismo se dedica a fabricar uniformes a estudiantes de  mas de 10 colegios ubicados en la ciudad de Cartagena, organizaciones en las cuales tiene un gran reconocimiento. Juan presenta un gran desafío y es que debe acudir a terceros para que realicen un buen terminado a la ropa, pues carece de una maquinaria que realice costuras en zig-zag, lo cual impide realizar algunos tipos de bordados y ojales necesarios para que el acabado sea perfecto, además de tener que pagar por ello de $700 COP a $1.000 COP, por cada uno, encareciendo el costo de cada producto. Juan no cuenta con un capital de trabajo suficiente, para invertir en materias primas y comprar una máquina al mismo tiempo, por eso recurre a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará una máquina de coser semi Industrial, para dar el acabado requerido a sus productos terminados. Inversión que será exitosa porque disminuye sus costos y los tiempos productivos, respondiendo así más efectivamente a su extendida clientela, que cada vez crece con mayor énfasis.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old, married, and the father of five children, ranging in ages from 8 to 25.  He has owned a clothing manufacturing workshop for 15 years, where he produces lines of women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing.  He also makes student uniforms for more than ten schools located in the city of Cartagena, organizations where he is well known.

Juan has a great challenge and must go to a third party to put the finishing touches on the clothing.  He does not have a sewing machine that can do zig zag stitches, which impedes him from making some types of borders and button holes needed so that the final product will be perfect.  He has to pay between 700 COP to 1,000 COP for each, which increases the cost of each item.

Juan does not have enough working capital to buy supplies and buy a new machine at the same time, so he needs a Kiva loan.  This will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine, in order to put the required finishing touches on his products.

This investment will be successful because it will reduce his costs and production time, and allow him to respond more effectively to his extended customers, which continually grow in numbers and emphasis.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia Nicolasa nació en el distrito de Chinchero de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, pero actualmente ella vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. 

La socia Nicolasa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. La socia Nicolasa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores cuyes y gallinas. La socia Nicolasa pertenece al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Nicolasa was born in the Chinchero district of the Urubamba province, located in the department of Cusco.  Currently, however, she lives in the Huchuy Qosqo community, located in the province of Calca, Cusco.

Nicolasa dedicates herself to raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She has been in this business for several years now, and things are going well thanks to the work she does.  Currently, Nicolasa needs a loan to buy more small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  Nicolasa is a member of the “Huchuy Qosqo” cooperative bank of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Su casa está ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito predominantemente agrícola, situado en la región Piura. 

Al igual que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona, solventa su economía con labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado cuenta con ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral, los cuales cría en corrales cercanos a su domicilio para luego venderlos una vez que hayan alcanzado el tamaño y peso adecuado. Adicionalmente cuenta con media hectárea de terreno agrícola en el cual ha sembrado limón, cada vez que cosecha este producto los vende junto con sus animales en el mercado local. 

Julio desea adquirir más animales para engordarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio. Esto le permitirá logar una mejor calidad de vida. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles. 

El es una persona con muchas ganas de superación. Sus vecinos dan muy buenas referencias de el.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old and a father.  He lives with his wife and two children and his house is located in of the settlements that make up the rural district of Tambogrande, a predominantly agricultural district located in the Piura region.

Most of the zone’s population works in agriculture.  He raises sheep, pigs, and corral birds, in pens located near his home.  He later sells them once they have reached the appropriate size and weight.  He also has a hectare of farm land where he has planted lemons.  Whenever he harvests this product, he sells them alongside his animals in the local market.

Julio would like to acquire more animals to fatten up and sell at an increased price.  This will allow him to create a better quality of life.  He has seen fit to request a loan of 800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  He is a man with a great desire to get ahead.  He has very good references from his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos. Su esposo es obrero de maquinaria agrícola y se ausenta por periodos largos del hogar, por lo que Enma esta bastante dedicada a su familia. La comunidad en donde reside es uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la vida allí es dura y sacrificada, no cuentan con algunos servicios básicos.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza de ganado caprino y aves de corral. Es apoyada por su suegra, juntas alimentan a sus animales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Ella cuenta con los conocimientos suficientes para la adecuada alimentación de los animales.

Enma se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales así como para realizar mejoras en el corral de los mismos. 

Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con nuestra institución demostrando ser una persona puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Enma is 29 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband and three children.  Her husband is a farm worker and runs farming equipment.  He is absent from the home for long periods of time and Enma is very dedicated to her family.  She lives in one of the settlements that make up the rural district of Tambogrande.  Life there is hard and requires sacrifice.  They do not have some of the basic services.

She has been raising goats and corral birds for four years.  She is backed up by her mother in law and they feed the animals together.  When the animals reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to buyers in the zone.  She has the appropriate knowledge on feeding the animals.

Enma is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in balanced feed for her animals, as well as make improvements to their pens.

She has had a previous loan through our institution and has demonstrated herself to be responsible in making her payments.

loans.use: to buy feed and make improvements to her animal pens.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive por  los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, su situación geográfica es muy accidentada y nos brinda hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 63 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, un hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la localidad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también cría  pollos y ganado. Trabaja en la agricultura labrando sus terrenos y las cosechas son para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. La mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a su tienda la cual tiene hace 40 años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nueva Amistad cooperative bank, located around the Cumbe en Cuenca parish.  This is an area where the climate is cold, the terrain is hilly, and it provides beautiful landscapes for enjoying nature.  Its people are dedicated to raising animals and farming, and they still retain the culture and tradition of their towns.

María is 63 years old and a widow; in her marriage, she had 6 children who are now all adults.  Four of them are married and living on their own, one son works and helps her out financially, and her youngest son studies at a school in the area.  The house she lives in belongs to her.

María dedicates herself to her household chores, and also raises chickens and livestock.  She also farms, working her land and harvesting her crops, which she uses for both home consumption and, if there is overage, to sell.  She dedicates the majority of her time tending to her store, which she has had for 40 years, working from Sunday to Sunday.

She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 10 years, and will invest her new loan into the purchase of provisions for her store.  

Her goal is to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: Dora Lorena

texts.es:
Dora es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en una de las zonas rurales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, caracterizado por su producción de mango y limón, la mayor parte de sus centros poblados rurales carecen de servicios básicos, en el caso del centro poblado de Dora, solo cuenta con energía eléctrica.

Se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral desde hace más de cinco años. Ella cuenta con corrales instalados en su domicilio, allí alimenta a sus animales con granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado local.

Dora desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo, asimismo desea poner techo en sus corrales, ya que el abrasante sol de la zona es bastante perjudicial y algunos de sus animales mueren. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

Ella ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente con Kiva y se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en aquella oportunidad, del mismo modo, agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella ahora.
texts.en:
Dora is a 20-year old mother who lives with her husband and small child in one of the rural zones that comprises the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This area is known for its mango and lemon production, and the majority of its population centers lack even basic public utilities.  In the case of the town of Dora, there is only the service of electricity.

She has dedicated herself to raising sheep, pigs and fowl for more than five years.  She has pens installed at her house, where she keeps her animals and feeds them grains and natural grasses.  When they have reached peak growth, she offers them for sale at the local market.

Dora wants to buy balanced feed so that her animals develop better.  She also wants to put roofs on her corrals given that the zone is very sunny, which is harmful, and some of her animals died.  To meet her objective, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles.

She has already had loans with Kiva, and is very grateful to the people who collaborated with her in that opportunity.  She gives thanks in advance to those individuals who may help her again this time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and install roofs on her corrals to improve her business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Lester Rolando

texts.es:
Lester tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el caserío Pueblo Libre, una de las comunidades que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, lugar de clima semi tropical, se caracteriza por producir grandes cantidades de frutas como el mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura. 

Se gana la vida a través de actividades relacionadas a la agricultura. Por un lado se dedica al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente de ganado ovino, los cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda, alimentándolos de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y en el mercado local. 

Adicionalmente cuenta con media hectárea de terreno agrícola heredada de sus padres en los cuales tiene instalado limón, el cual cosecha frecuentemente y también comercializa junto a sus animales. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus propios gastos y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento económico. 

Lester desea construir una pequeña casa al lado de la de sus padres, para poder adquirir cierta independencia. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

El es una persona responsable y trabajadora. Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito financiado por Kiva, el cual le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante con sus actividades. El se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad.
texts.en:
Lester is 31 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  He lives at his parents’ home in the Pueblo Libre neighborhood, one of the communities that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a place with a semi-tropical climate, and characterized as being a grand producer of fruit, such as mango and lemon.  It’s part of the Piura region.


He makes a living doing agriculture.  He raises and sells small livestock, especially sheep.  He raises them in pens located behind his home and feeds them natural grasses.  When they have reached a good stage of development, he offers them for sale to buyers in the zone and at the local marketplace.  He also has a hectare of farmland, which he inherited from his parents, and where he has planted lemons, which he harvests often and sells alongside his animals.  He uses the income to cover his own expenses and financially support his family.


Lester wants to build a small house alongside his parents’ house, so that he can gain some independence, so he has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, to help him meet his objective.

He is a responsible and hardworking person.  He has had a previous Kiva loan, which helped him very much to get ahead with his businesses.  He is very grateful to those who supported him with that opportunity.

loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y ya no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, específicamente en la parte urbana del distrito. La zona es agrícola y productora de mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura. 


Su actividad es la venta de pollo fresco en su propio domicilio, usualmente realiza entregas a clientes ya establecidos por pedidos y también a sus vecinos. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace cuatro años. Su esposo es profesor y la apoya en todas las actividades que realiza. Juntos, con mucho esfuerzo, sacan adelante a su hogar.


Genara está solicitando un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería y obtener ingresos suficientes para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir a sus pagos. Se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que la apoyaron en ese momento y agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella.
texts.en:
Genara is 45 years old.  She’s married and her children are grown.  She lives with her husband in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, specifically in the urban part of the district.  It’s an agricultural zone and a producer of mangos and lemons.  It’s part of the Piura region. 

She sells fresh chicken out of her home.  She usually delivers orders to established customers and neighbors and has been doing this for four years.  Her husband is a professor and supports her in all her activities.  Together, with great effort, they move their household forward.

Genara is asking for a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy more merchandise and obtain enough income to make improvements to her house.  She has had previous Kiva loans and has demonstrated herself to be responsible in making her payments.  She is very grateful to the people who support her and to the helping hands of those who cooperate with her.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Irma Violeta

texts.es:
Irma tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y sus hijos ya se encuentran independizados. Radica en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un bar – restaurante instalado en su domicilio desde hace más de cuarenta años. Allí ella ofrece diversos platos de comida y bebidas a sus clientes. La buena atención y la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos han hecho que su negocio sea uno de los preferidos de la zona. Con este negocio ella y su esposo sacaron adelante a su familia y ahora ella lo mantiene en memoria de él y de el obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos.

Irma desea remodelar su local y darle una nueva vista a su negocio, de modo que sus clientes se sientan más a gusto y pueda aumentar su demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su negocio y bastante trabajadora, las personas que le conocen le consideran una excelente persona. Irma agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada por los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Irma, 62 years old, is a widow and her children are now independent. She lives in the agricultural district of Oyotún, an area over an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region.

She works at a bar and restaurant that has been set up in her home for over 40 years. There, she offers diverse dishes and drinks to her customers. The good attention and good seasoning with which she prepares food have made her business one of the preferred places in the area. With this business, she and her husband moved their family forward and now she maintains in in memory of him. From this business, she earns the necessary income to pay her expenses. 

Irma wants to remodel her bar and restaurant to give the business a new look, so that her customers feel more at home and so she can increase her demand. This is why she has requested her first loan of 2000 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can achieve her objective.

She is dedicated to her business and hard-working, the people that know her consider her an excellent person. Irma appreciates the cooperation and help given through Kiva loans.

loans.use: to remodel her business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, age 49, who is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rosario operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil or an egg. Martina earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Additionally, she has a direct selling business and also sells silver accessories. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Rosario is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosario hopes to be able to expand soon as she dreams of being a successful businesswoman some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es: Alvaro Jose casado de 51 años de edad tiene por actividad economica desde hace siete años  un cyber el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el negocio lo inico hace siete años con el propisito de buscar nuevos  ingresos para su familia ,en la actulidad con los prestamos que ha recibido de fundacion leon 2000 ha mejorado su servicio de cyber ya que la invertido activo fijo al negocio de esa forma ha incrementado su clientela en esta ocacion el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de una impresoras y computadoras, el servicio que presta es servicios de internet, impresiones a colores, impresiones blanco y  negro, levantado de texto, fotocopias entre otros.
texts.en:
Alvaro Jose is married and 51 years old.  For the past seven years, his business activity has been providing Internet and computer services from his house.  He started the business with the goal of finding new sources of income for his family.

Currently, with the loans he has received from the Leon 2000 Foundation, he has improved his services given that he has been able to invest in the business, which has allowed him to increase his customer base.  

He is requesting this loan because he wants to buy some printers and computers.  The services he provides include Internet access, color and black and white printing, document scanning, and photocopying, among others.

loans.use: to purchase printers and computers.  The services he provides include Internet access, color and black and white printing, document scanning, and photocopying, among others.

loans.name: Pichdara

texts.en:
Pichdara (in the photo), age 30, is a tailor. Her husband, Rim, age 30, is a driver for a garment factory. The couple has been married since 2010 and they have no children yet. They live about 20 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh in Cambodia. 

Currently, Pichdara has one sewing machine. She wants to hire more tailors to expand her tailoring business but she does not have enough sewing machines. Therefore, Pichdara is asking for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $700 in order to purchase two more sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy two more sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Yoanna Milena

texts.es: Yoanna tiene un negocio donde vende “purina y crecedor, así como también maíz en concha, trilla de afrecho, maíz pilado, cuchuco y cabecita” que son las diversas caracterizaciones del maíz, que tienen diferentes usos en la alimentación Colombiana; Yoanna también vende  sacos y representan ingresos adicionales con los que usualmente cuenta.  Para el desempeño en su negocio tiene una máquina de dos latas para trillar maíz y una experiencia familiar que inició desde hace 4 años, con muy poco capital, pero con la ayuda de Dios y esfuerzos conjuntos de su familia, han logrado sácalo adelante y ser cada día mas competitivos. Su meta principal es impulsar el crecimiento de su negocio, porque su clientela se incrementa, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente, para responderle, convirtiéndose esta situación en su principal desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará materias primas (maíz), en mayor volumen, inversión que Yoanna considera será exitosa, porque siempre tendrá productos que ofrecer a su creciente clientela; en un futuro planea comprar una máquina para obtener el cuchuco (un alimento que consiste en el maíz, la cebada o trigo en grano pelado y trozado o semimolido, que se usa para hacer sopas en Colombia) y por eso poco a poco se concentrará en fortalecer su producción y con ello su clientela, para finalmente lograr un sueño compartido con su esposo, que no es otro que ver crecer a sus dos hijos, hoy  en las edades de 4 y 9 años, en condiciones que potencialicen su éxito profesional.
texts.en:
Yoanna has a business where she sells purina animal feed and grower, as well as heads of corn, threshing bran, hulled corn, cuchuco and cabecita, which are different characteristics of corn and have different uses in Colombian nutrition. Yoanna also sells sacks which give her an extra income which she counts on. In order to run her business she has a machine with two tins for threshing corn as well as family experience. She started four years ago with very little capital but with God's help and her joint family efforts they have managed to get their family ahead and become more competitive every day.

Her main goal in is continue extending her business, because her client base is increasing but she does not have enough capital to respond to the demand, so this situation has become her main challenge. This is the reason why she has come to Cridkiva for her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy supplies (corn) in large quantities. Yoanna thinks this investment will be successful because she will always have products to offer to her growing number of customers. In the future she plans to buy a machine to obtain cuchuco (a food which consists of corn, barley or wheat grains peeled and chopped or semi ground, which are used to make soups in Columbia) and so she hopes to concentrate on strengthening her production and therefore her client base in order to finally fulfil a dream she shares with her husband; to see their two children grow up, today they are 4 and 9 years old, in conditions which boost their professional success.

loans.use: to buy supplies (corn) in large quantities

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is married and works hard to support her three children. She has a network marketing business selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Janelyn has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a disk lamp in order to provide her children with a bright light when they study at night.

Janelyn is aware that by using the disk lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a disk lamp in order to provide her children with a bright light when they study at night.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 66-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora. She provides for her child's needs with the small income of 3,000 PHP she earns monthly from her own gardening business. She has had her business for three years. 

Since 2011, she's been a member of GDMPC. She is applying for a loan with GDMPC in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Florencia wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and works hard to support her family. Juanita has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.

Juanita is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp in order to have a backup light in case of an emergency.

Juanita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will save money, help the environment and reduce health risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La socia Lourdes nació en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente ella vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la misma provincia donde nació. La socia Lourdes se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. La socia Lourdes en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas. La socia Lourdes sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The group-member Lourdes was born in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco but she now lives in the community of Huchuy Qosqo in the same province where she was born. Lourdes continues working in the area of raising small animals such as guinea-pigs, pigs and chickens. She has now been working in this area for many years and it is going very well for her thanks to the work she is doing.

Lourdes is asking for this loan to buy small animals such as pigs, guinea-pigs and chickens.  Lourdes continues with the communal bank “Huchuy Qosqo” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Siyang

texts.en:
Siyang, 57 years old, and her husband Van Dy, 58, live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two are garment workers and another is attending school.

Both farmers, Siyang and her husband grow corn and potatoes. Siyang is requesting a loan for $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and pay fees for renting more plots of farmland from her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm and pay fees for renting more plots of farmland from her neighbors.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is 39 years old, married and has three children.  She resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweet cakes for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $2 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Touch is requesting a loan for $500, which she will use to purchase cattle to resell for a profitable price. This money will help her start a new business and earn extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Milagroso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA MILAGROSO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosana ella es soltera y tiene 44 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende chompas,guantes,chalinas,polos y gorros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia distribuye la artesanía a las diferentes tiendas donde venden artesanía, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, polos, guantes y chalinas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de vinos, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de lubricentro y negocio de alquiler de camioneta.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca Milagroso”, which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Rosana is one of the members who is 44 years old, single, and has one child. She works in her handicraft business where she sells sweaters, gloves, scarves, pullover shirts, and caps. Rosana works from 8am to 7pm. She distributes these crafts to different stores that sell these types of products. Through her business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell these handicrafts. Rosana is requesting a loan in order to buy sweaters, pullover shirts, gloves, and scarves. She is seen in a separate photo that was taken after the meeting because she requested permission to be absent for work reasons.

The other members engage in businesses that include selling wines, selling fruit, managing an oil change center, and renting out trucks.

Rosana is grateful to everyone who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted sweaters, pullover shirts, gloves, and scarves.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, a 32-year-old resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a vendor, and the mother of three children. The entire family manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Victoria operates a street-vending business selling biscuits, candies and newspapers. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers, her regular clients being her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Victoria is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Victoria hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of newspapers and other assorted products needed in her business.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reina María madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. su actividad económica es el comercio de ropa nueva desde hace más de siete  años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia y poder sustentarse.. La solicitud del crédito será utilizada para capital de trabajo, para comprar ropa nueva, perfumes, pantalones, camisas y cosméticos. Ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante, la mercadería entre sus clientes que son amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Reina Maria  anteriormente ha recibido préstamos de parte de la Fundación, mejorando su forma de vida y sus ingresos de esta forma ha podido subsistir durante este tiempo. Como cualquier persona tiene aspiraciones y su meta es llegar a tener una tienda en un lugar propio,
texts.en:
Reina María is a single mother with two dependent children. Her business involves selling new clothes, something she has done for more than seven years. This business came about because she needed to have a source of income to support her family.

Her loan request will be used as operating capital for buying new clothes, perfumes, trousers, shirts, and cosmetics. She offers her products as a traveling vendor. Her merchandise is delivered to her customers, which include friends, relatives, and co-workers. Reina María previously received loans from Fundación León 2000, which improved her way of life and her income so that she could survive this entire time. Like any other person who has aspirations, Reina María has established a goal of opening a store in a place of her own.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, perfumes, trousers, shirts, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Antehweh Group

texts.en:
Antehwe is a group of two women with average age of 48 years. They are on their third and fourth loans. 

These women sells fish and cooking oil at Teshie, a town in the greater Accra region.

Dora, standing from right in the picture, is a cooking oil seller. She is able to generate 40 GHS monthly, of which she will use part to repay her loan. She will invest part of the loan into her current business and purchase a water reservoir to help her generate more income.

They need an amount of 1,300 GHS.

loans.use: To buy more goods so that they can meet customers needs.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Universal is a group of two married women and one single woman who live at Teshie. Their average age is 41 years. They have an average of three children. They sell fish, baked goods and cloth.

Lovelace is in the bakery business. She plans to use the loan to buy flour, margarine and eggs. She is on her third loan with ID-Ghana. She buys her goods from the market and bakes to supply her customers. She makes a profit of 60 GHS monthly.

They need an amount of 1,350 GHS.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice is a 36-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. She lives at Teshie. 

She sells provisions such as milk, Milo (a chocolate milk powder), soap, sugar and soft drinks. She has been selling these products for five years. She operates her provision store in the community. 

She needs an amount of GHS 350, which she will use to buy goods for sale.

This is her first loan and it could make a profit of $32 monthly. She will use the profit to support her family.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell at her grocery shop.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío San Pablo, una de las comunidades rurales que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la comunidad tiene una calidad de vida bastante humilde y precaria, las viviendas están construidas de material rústico y no cuentan con servicios básicos. 

Se dedica desde hace más de once años a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral. Actualmente cuenta con 10 ovejas, 12 pavos y 5 cerdos, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Su esposo le ayuda en la crianza de sus animales. Usualmente les alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. 

Marleni desea ampliar si negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

Marleni es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive. Ella ya ha tenido anteriormente un crédito financiado a través de Kiva. Gracias a ese préstamo pudo hacer varios avances en su negocio. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Marleni is 30 years old and a mother.  She lives with her husband and children in the San Pablo settlement, one of the rural communities that make up the Tambogrande agricultural district.  The community has a humble and precarious quality of life.  The homes are built from rustic materials and do not include the basic services.


She has been raising livestock for more than eleven years; sheep, pigs, corral birds.  She currently has 10 sheep, 12 turkeys, and 5 pigs, which she raises in an area behind her home.  Her husband helps raise the animals.  She usually feeds the animals with natural grains and grasses.



Marleni wants to expand her business by acquiring more animals and balanced feed, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,300 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her achieve her goal.

Mareni is a well-known and admired woman in her zone.  She has had a previous loan through Kiva.  Thanks to this loan she has been able to make various advancements in her business.  She is very grateful to those who have supported her.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
