Yolanda is from La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has 3 children. To make a living, Yolanda plants and harvests bananas and coconuts. She is 2 years in this business and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Yolanda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joane

texts.en:
This is Joane, 40, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marzan, her business partner and father to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joane maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also sells snacks for additional income. She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Joane dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is from San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 59 years old. Ricardo is married and has five children. Ricardo used his last loan to purchase fertilizers. His business is successful, and he's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
Asesewa is a group based in the community of Teshie with five members who are women. They are married with an average of four children. This is their second loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They sell the following commodities; vegetables, kenkey (maize paste), fish and cassava at the central market in Accra.

Grace is a kenkey (maize paste) and fish seller. She buys her materials from the central market. This loan will enable her to increase her profit from 30 GHS to 70 GHS, which will be used to support her husband.

They need an amount of 2,250 GHS.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom (in the photo) has been driving a tuk tuk taxi for two months. Previously, he was a garment worker. His wife, Samat, is a tailor. Sokhom is asking for his first Kiva loan to pay for purchasing the tuk tuk because he bought it, but he does not give money yet. 

Sokhom and his wife have been married since 2006 and they have two young children. They live in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a divorced woman with five children who are between 15 and 38 years of age in the city of Mombasa, where she works selling mahamri (dumplings) and Khangas (African womens wrap cloth) to support her home. 

Binti is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her two businesses more each time and plans to use this loan to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil and bales of clothes at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan which will make the investment successful. This is why she’s very competitive when she sells the products and earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking fat oil and bales of clothes

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.es:
Maria  tiene 68 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con uno de ellos en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene una actividad de negocio el cual le genera ingresos para su manutención. Es la elaboración y venta de tortillas y compra y venta de leña. Hace 10 años trabaja vendiendo tortillas la cual ya cuenta con su propia clientela, Es una señor muy conocida en la colonia donde vive destacándose por una mujer muy trabajadora  que se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar para sacar sus hijos adelante, sus hijos ya están mayores y le ayudan con algunos gastos.  
Ella es una excelente cliente de ODEF con la cual  lleva 9 créditos, actualmente solicita el préstamo numero  diez  de 16,000 lempiras que lo invertirá en comprar insumos como harina de maíz, compra de leña para consumo y venta para la elaboración de las tortillas y otra parte la destinara para hacerle mejoras a un apartamento que tiene para alquiler donde obtendrá otro ingreso extra que le ayudara ha mejorar  económicamente.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes, también piensa que con las ganancias que obtenga de la venta de tortillas podrá  seguir mejorando los apartamentos que tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is 68 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives with one of them in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Doña Maria has a business that generates income to support herself. She makes and sells tortillas, but she also sells firewood. Maria has been selling tortillas for 10 years and already has her own customer base. She is a well-known lady in the subdivision where she lives and has a reputation for being a hardworking woman who has dedicated her entire life to helping her children get ahead. Her children are already grown and help with some of the expenses.

Maria is an excellent client of ODEF and has received nine loans. Her current loan request, the tenth one, is for 16,000 HNL that will be invested in supplies such as cornmeal and firewood to sell as well as to use in making tortillas. Part of the loan will also be used to make improvements to an apartment she rents out as an additional source of income. This will help her improve financially. Her goal is to continue working by attending to her customers. Maria also plans to use her earnings to obtain a tortilla stand so that she can continue making improvements to her rental apartments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making tortillas, to acquire firewood to sell, and to pay for improvements to a rental apartment.

loans.name: Victor Leandro

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su hijo de 17 años, lamentablemente desde hace muchos años por diversas circunstancias se divorció de su esposa y desde entonces ha sido padre y madre para su hijo quien es su razón y motivo para seguir perseverando y salir adelante en la vida.
Víctor siempre ha sido un hombre muy entusiasta y trabajador, él ha realizado diversos trabajos, uno  de ellos fue en una de las minas de la ciudad, donde lamentablemente en este último perdió la visión del ojo izquierdo; desde hace 4 años y gracias a la ayuda de su familia, Víctor pudo poner en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, él cuenta con buenos clientes los cuales gustan de su comida por su buena sazón, carisma y trato amable.
Víctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una congeladora, la cual es muy necesaria para poder guardar productos perecibles como carne y verduras que compra y utiliza para cocinar, de esta manera podrá aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder brindarle a su hijo una educación superior ya que desea verlo convertirse en un buen profesional y en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Victor is a 57-year-old gentleman who lives in the city of Pisco with his 17-year-old son. Many years ago due to various unfortunate circumstances, Victor and his wife divorced, thereby leaving him to be both father and mother to his son. For this reason, he continues to persevere and press forward in life. Victor has always been a very enthusiastic and hardworking man. He has held various jobs, one of them working as a miner in the city, which unfortunately led to him losing his vision in his left eye. Four years ago, with the help of his family, Victor was able to proceed with establishing a small business selling food. He has good clients who enjoy his delicious food, his charisma, and his friendly service.

Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy a freezer that he needs for preserving perishable supplies, such as meat and vegetables that he uses in cooking. This will help to increase his sales and his earnings. Gradually over time, Victor hopes to save enough money to provide his son with a college education because he wants him to become a successful professional and a well-mannered man.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Rigoberto Del Socorro

texts.es: Rigoberto  casado con 70 años de edad  del municipio de chinandega tiene por actividad economica de venta de meracaderia en general, rigoberto inico su negocio cuando se julio ya que el esfuerzo de mucho años para tener una herramienta de trabajo propia, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superandose e introducion nueva mercaderia para  sastifacion de la clientela, a traves del financiamiento ha  podido cumplir sus sueños y metas como es mejora su vivienda e invertir en el negocio comprara mercaderia como:  pantalones de hombre y mujer, casmisas, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, ropa de niño entre, calzado de dama y hombre, entre otros.
texts.en: Rigoberto, married and 70 years old, from the city of Chinandega, works in the sale of general merchandise. Rigoberto started his business when he retired as he had worked many years in order to be able to have his own business. The business is located in his home, and with much effort he has been able to get ahead and introduce new merchandise to satisfy his clients. Through financing, he has been able to complete his dreams and his goals such as improving his home and investing in his business, by buying merchandise such as: men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and children's clothes among other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, and chidren's clothes

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim and her husband, Chantha, have been married since 1995 and they have two sons and one daughter. All of them are attending school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Sokim is a rice farmer, while her husband is a policeman who also produces furniture for sale at his home. 

Sokim asks for a loan in the amount of $500 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

In the photo, Sokim is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her second son is a factory worker. Her youngest son and a daughter are in school, and her eldest son helps his father in his milk sales business.
  
Kaniz herself is involved in sewing work. She also manages the household chores along with her sewing work. She loves her family and takes much care of them. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to them by fulfilling their needs. 

Kaniz's husband has a buffalo from which he gets milk and then sells to the milk shops. He has been operating his business for many years and has a good reputation among his customers. 

Earlier, he managed the work on his own, but now his son's presence has become very fruitful and helpful for him.
 
With the loan investment, her husband will purchase another buffalo, which will increase the milk productivity and also give a boost to his sales. This will definitely generate good profits for him.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Max Alexander

texts.es:
Max es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la linda ciudad de chincha, la cual alberga a gran población de origen afroperuano, sus pobladores se caracterizan también porque tiene una habilidad para la preparación de platillos ya que lo hacen de manera deliciosa, asimismo la ciudad de Chincha es La cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables y carismáticos. Max vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tienen una pequeña bebe a quien adora mucho y por quien da la vida con tal de darle lo necesario para vivir. Cuando Max tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la Carapulcra con sopa seca.

Día a día Max trabaja  como obrero descargando materiales en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, no tiene un horario fijo ya que depende mucho de los materiales que en el día se puedan descargar, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrado en su trabajo.

Max agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina, así como también acondicionar el cuarto donde viven, pondrá drywall, ya que es de material rustico y  seria dañino para su bebe, con esta mejora ya no tendrá que cocinar a leña y podrá darle un mejor ambiente para vivir a su hija, así el podrá seguir trabajando y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Max is a hardworking and enthusiastic young man who lives in the beautiful city of Chicha.  This is town is home to a large population with Afro-Peruvian origins.  Its residents are also notable for their cuisine, which is very delicious.  In addition, the town of Chicha is the hometown of some of Peru's biggest sports stars.  Most of all, its people are very friendly and charismatic.  Max lives with his wife, and they have a small baby that they love very much, and for whom they are providing everything that is needed.  When Max has free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors, and at times he enjoys one of his favorite dishes, one of which is "La Carapulcra" (a pork dish) with noodles.

Each day, Max works unloading materials for a company in the city.  He works about 8 hours a day.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule, because his work hours depend on how much of the material in a day he is able to unload.  He believes that his work is going well because he is very responsible and most of all, honest in his work.

Max is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, he will be able to buy a stove and also make some improvements to the room where he lives.  He will put in drywall, since the room is currently made of more rustic materials that could be harmful to his baby.  With this improvement he will not have to use firewood to cook, so he will be able to provide a better living  environment  for his daughter.  Also, he is going to continue to work so that he can continue to strive to make his biggest dream a reality: to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a stove and to put drywall on the walls of his home

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande, en la región Piura. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y obsequios para varios eventos. Para poder desarrollar su actividad ha instalado su negocio  en la sala de sus suegros. Ellos la apoyan brindándole ese espacio de su casa para su negocio.

Verónica tiene muchos  clientes  y cuenta con la fidelidad de muchos de ellos, su negocio es muy conocido gracias a su esfuerzo. Ella cuenta con una muy buena ubicación estratégica para la venta ya que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la zona urbana del distrito.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo de  2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de prendas de vestir de estación, así como algunos obsequios. Ella tiene un espíritu emprendedor, quiere que su negocio crezca por lo que pone todo su esfuerzo en ello, pues ella desea  ser una empresaria de éxito.

Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad. Por ahora agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Verónica is the mother of a family, is 28 years old, and resides with her family in the urban zone of the district of Tambogrande, region of Piura. She works in the sale of apparel and gifts for various events. In order to be able to develop her activities she has installed her business in the living room of her in-laws. They support her by providing this space in their house for her business.

Verónica has many clients and has the loyalty of many of them; her business is very well known thanks to her effort. She has a very good strategic location for her sales, as she is located in the center of the urban zone of the district.

Currently she is asking for a loan of 2,500 soles that she will invest in the purchase of seasonal apparel and gifts. She has an entrepreneurial spirit, and she wants her business to grow so she puts all of her effort into it - she wants to be a successful business woman. 

Previously she had a loan from Kiva and she was extremely grateful for the people who supported her with that opportunity. She thanks in advance the people who collaborate with her on this occasion as well.

loans.use: to restock her business with seasonal apparel and gifts

loans.name: Astrid Aracelly

texts.es: Astrid Aracely   soltera  con 29 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad  tiene por actividad economica de venta de meracaderia en general, desde hace siete años Astrid Aracely  inico como  un medio de subsitencia ya que no tiene un trabajo fijo el negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superandose e introducion nueva mercaderia para  sastifacion de la clientela, a traves del financiamiento ha  podido cumplir sus sueños y metas como es mejora su vivienda e invertir en el negocio comprara mercaderia  nueva para aprovecha la temporado festiva en su localidad mercaderia como :  cosmeticos,  pantalones de hombre y mujer, casmisas, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, ropa de niño entre, calzado de dama y hombre, entre otros.
texts.en: Astrid Aracely, single and 29 years old with two young children, has worked in the sale of general merchandise for the past seven years. Astrid Aracely started her business as a way to survive as she no longer had a fixed job. She conducts her business door-to-door, and with much effort she has been able to get ahead and introduce new merchandise to satisfy her clients. Through financing, she has been able to complete her dreams and goals of improving her home and investing in her business. With this loan she will buy new merchandise to take advantage of the festival season in her town, buy buying items such as: cosmetics, men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, children's clothes, and men's and women's footwear, among others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, underwear, children's clothes, and men's and women's shoes among other items

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 44 years old, is married, has four children, and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.

To help her family financially, Editha has a mini grocery store that generates PHP 15,000 per month. Editha sells different kinds of food, fruits, spices, and refreshments.

Editha has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 from GDMPC to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (chocolate powder), shampoo, soaps, etc. Editha has been a member of GDMPC for more than five years. In the future, she hopes that she will have a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Guillerma has been in this business for three years. Guillerma earns additional income from motorcycle transportation.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items like ready-to-wear clothing, body lotions, perfumes and other beauty supplies to sell.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like ready-to-wear clothing, body lotions, perfumes and other beauty supplies to sell.

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en:
Medhat is a 26-year-old single man.

He is employed, but the salary he gets isn't enough to cover his needs. For the past four years, Medhat has also been purchasing and selling used spare parts such as generators, blacksmith tools and compressors. This has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover the costs and purchases.

Medhat is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more used spare parts to resell. This will increase sales and improve Medhat's income.

Medhat is photographed in his store.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To buy used spare parts to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty-three-year-old married man with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a lab technician for sixteen years and with his meager salary he has been able to promptly provide the basics to his family although with difficulty. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation which has led all prices of basic needs to increase. His personal goal is educating his children and he also has a dream of starting a retail shop so as to supplement his salary. John wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 43, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Gill, her business partner, and a mother to her child. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a food stall and also delivers bread for additional income, her regular customers consisting of her neighbors and the local community.   In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is both family tradition and a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered wasteful to spend money on cooking gas and food for one to two persons when cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.  Lilibeth earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilibeth dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Calistro

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, es padre soltero  y tiene 3 hijos, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula  junto a con sus hijos.
Don José desde hace 23 años tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería como  pantalones, blusas, faldas, short, camisas etc. Para damas, caballeros y niños. Con este negocio don José ha podido solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado del centro de la ciudad en el cual manifiesta que hasta el momento le ha ido bien. También dice que hay temporadas que las ventas bajan. Pero con su esfuerzo y dedicación en mantener los precios en la ropa ha logrado conservar los clientes y el negocio esta estable.
El  esta solicitando un préstamo con Odef de 15,000 lempiras para poder comprar más mercadería como camisas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, short etc.  Para surtir el negocio y ofrecer variedad de prendas de vestir.
Su meta es tener un local más grande para exhibir mejor su mercadería para que sus ventas aumenten y poder ofrecer a sus hijos todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José, age 53, is a single father, and he has three children.  He lives in the city of San Pedro Sula with his children.

For 23 years José has been selling merchandise like pants, blouses, skirts, shorts, and shirts, etc.  for women, men, and children.  With this business José has been able to pay for his children’s necessities.  

He has his business established in the central market of the city, and he says that it is going well for him so far.  He also says that there are seasons when sales are low.  However, with his effort and dedication to maintaining the prices of the clothes, he has managed to keep his customers, and his business is stable.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF for 15,000 lempira in order to buy more merchandise like shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, and shorts etc.  He will do this to stock the business and to offer a greater variety of clothes.

His goal is to have a larger place in order to better display his merchandise.  He will do this so that his sales increase, and he will be all to give his children everything they need.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, and shorts etc.to stock his business and provide his customers' with variety.

loans.name: Johnny Alberto

texts.es:
Johnny es un joven de 21 años, soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es un joven muy entusiasta que ha trabajado desde muy joven, ya que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de salir adelante; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de trabajo, y en algunas ocasiones prepara un delicioso “Arroz con Pollo” para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho esmero y entusiasmo Johnny culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de Contabilidad que tanto quería; desde muy joven Jhonny ha realizado diferentes trabajos, actualmente trabaja como agente de seguridad en un minimarket de la ciudad, él trabaja en turnos rotativos y puede llegar a laborar hasta por 12 horas diarias.
Johnny se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de su matrícula, así como la compra de sus libros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder iniciar sus estudios de Contabilidad que tanto desea; de esta manera Johnny podrá asegurar su futuro profesional.
texts.en:
Johnny is a young man of 21 years of age, single, who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is an enthusiastic young man who has worked from a very young age, as he has a great desire to get ahead in life. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from work, and occasionally he prepares a delicious "Arroz con Pollo" (chicken and rice dish) to share with his family. 

With much care and enthusiasm Johnny finished his secondary schooling, but unfortunately because of a lack of economic resources he could not pursue the accounting career that he really wanted to study. Since he was very young Johnny has worked many different jobs, and currently works as a security guard in a mini-market in the city; he works rotating shifts and can work up to 12 hours per day. 

Johnny is very grateful for Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to cover matriculation costs, as well as buy the course books, which will be very helpful for him to begin his studies in accounting as he wishes. In this way, Johnny will be able to ensure a professional future.

loans.use: to cover matriculation costs and to buy books

loans.name: Ledy Yuli

texts.es:
Ledy es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos dependientes en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Mochumí, una de las zonas con mayor producción agrícola de la región Lambayeque.

Ella ha creado hace poco una pequeña bodega que tiene instalada en su vivienda. Allí ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Sus clientes trabajan con ella tanto al contado como al crédito y debido a su buena atención, cada día tiene mayor acogida de clientes. Adicionalmente cría animales, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Chiclayo los días viernes.

Ledy se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su negocio y en la compra de animales ara seguir negociándolos. Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad.
texts.en:
Ledy is the mother of her family, is 32 years old, and lives with her husband and four young children in one of the farmhouses that comprise the rural part of the district of Mochumí, one of the areas with the greatest agricultural production in the region of Lambayeque.

She created a short while ago a bodega that she has installed in her home. There she offers her clients all types of basic need and grocery products. Her clients work with her on both a cash and credit basis, and thanks to her great service every day she has more and more satisfied clients. Additionally she raises animals, which she sells in the city of Chiclayo on Fridays.

Ledy is asking for a loan of 2,500 soles which she will use to buy groceries to stock her business and to buy animals to continue trading them. She has already had a loan financed by Kiva, and she is extremely grateful for the people who have supported her with that opportunity.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock the bodega she has in her home

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Inroad, Aurora. He earns through farming, cultivating coconuts for 20 years, so as to support the needs of his three children. He gets an income of 15,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 50-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Francis is borrowing the amount of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. He joined GDMPC in 2011. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jophes

texts.en: Jophes is a 39-year-old man married with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for over fifteen years. His personal goal is to educate his children to attain high qualifications since he is just a certificate holder. He has challenges of low salary which makes it hard for him to at minimum provide the basics for his family, however he plans to start up a piggery project so as to supplement his income. Jophes intends to pay school fees for his children with the loan facility.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 41 years old and married with three children.  With all her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is a humble woman who lives in Tiribe, Kenya with her seven children whose ages range from 26 to 32 years. She fries fish every day and sells fried fish. She is located nearby the market where little by little she has gained clients' trust and affection. With this business Bidalla is able to sustain her family and she has high expectations for growing this business since she works hard every day. 

Today her main clients are neighbors and passers-by., however she wants to take more opportunities. Her investment plan consists of diversifying her merchandise, adding more products requested by clients such as chicken, grilled beef, pork rinds, etc. This will improve her working conditions and amplify her product selection according to her clients' demand. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva to expand her business, purchase bundles of fish and cooking fat oil. She believes she can succeed due to the high demand, her strength in her performance, and work discipline. All of these qualities will help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and cooking fat.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 36 years old and has two children. Alona is married and both her children are in school.

Alona is in the seaweed-culture business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy seaweed and materials for the culture of seaweeds.

Alona has been this business for 10 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seaweed to be cultured.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Flordelis would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida. Su pareja es Orlando, quien es soldador y el padre de sus hijos, quienes ya son independientes y tienen familia aparte, pero la visitan constantemente. Vive en compañía de su pareja y su nieta Andrea de 8 años, en su casa propia.
Su negocio lo realiza junto a su pareja. Elaboran estructuras de fierro como puertas, ventanas y otros, en su mayoría a pedido de sus clientes. Él se encarga de la parte de la soldadura y ella de los acabados finales y la venta del producto terminado. Para esto cuenta con un espacio acondicionado en su vivienda, donde tienen las herramientas y máquinas de corte y soldar. Se inició hace más de 30 años con una pequeña máquina de soldar que compró con su propio capital, contando con su pareja desde el comienzo. Le gusta su actividad, por contar con un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hogar, además de estar en la compañía de su pareja, le permite distraerse.
Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con los miembros de  su banco comunal, pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales (fierro, soldaduras, hojas de sierra, pintura, mimbres, limaduras y otros), necesarios para la continuidad de su actividad y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes por entregar.
texts.en:
Maria, 54, is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman who is also cheerful and extroverted.  Her partner is Orlando; he is a welder and is the father of her children.  They are now independent and have their own families, but they visit all the time.  She lives in her own home with her partner and her granddaughter, Andrea, who is 8 years old. 

Maria carries out her business with her partner.  They make steel structures such as: doors, windows and other structures, mainly based on orders from their customers.  He is in charge of the welding part, and she does the finishing touches and sells the finished products.  To do this work, they have a space set up in their home where they have their tools and their cutting and welding machines.  She started this business more than 30 years ago with a small welding machine that she bought with her own capital, relying on her partner from the start.  She likes this work, because it gives her an income that allows her to cover her personal and household expenses.  She also enjoys working with her partner, because she enjoys his company.

This is her third loan with the MFP institution, and she is committed to making her payments as she did with her previous loans.  Also, she feels comfortable with the members of her communal bank, because they are responsible and supportive people.

With the sum of 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy materials (steel, welding materials, saw blades, paint, wicker, metal files, and other items), that she needs to continue with her business and fill existing orders.

loans.use: to buy steel, welding materials, saw blades, paint, wicker, metal files, and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, además de tener mucho entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Liborio, el padre de sus cuatro hijos: Cintia de 25 años, Dante de 23, Atler de 22 y Lesly de 18 años. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de bebidas desde su casa. Cuenta con dos refrigeradoras donde guarda las botellas a baja temperatura, como les agrada a sus clientes, debido al clima caluroso de la zona. Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio y además que ya contaba con una refrigeradora. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención de los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su actividad por contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que el sueldo como vigilante no les alcanzaba. Ha logrado crecer en el volumen y variedad del stock de sus productos. El problema es cuando llueve muy seguido, pues disminuyen sus ventas, pero eso no la desanima, ya que sabe que es algo que no puede controlar. Tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio instalando una fuente de soda, para vender otras cosas además de bebidas.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en préstamos anteriores. Además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, en mayor cantidad y a menor precio, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, is a hardworking and happy woman who has a lot of enthusiasm and desire to get ahead. Her partner is Liborio, the father of their four children: Cintia, 25, Dante, 23, Atler, 22 and Lesly, 18. 

Her business is selling beverages out of her home. She has two refrigerators where she stores the bottles nice and cold, which her customers like due to the heat where they live. She started this more than 5 years ago with her own capital and one refrigerator. She has her kids help attending to customers when she's out of the house. She likes this business because she earns money to support her husband with the costs of their home, since his salary as a watchman isn't enough. She has been able to increase her stock in both volume and variety of products. A challenge is when it rains a lot because her sales go down, but that doesn't discourage her because she knows it's not something she can control. She plans to increase her business by installing a soda fountain so she can sell things besides drinks.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments as she has with previous loans. With the requested 1500 nuevos soles she will purchase sodas of different brands and flavors, in high quantity and for a low price, so that she can get the best profit margins.

loans.use: to buy sodas of different brands and flavors.

loans.name: Miriam Gabriela

texts.es: Miriam vive en Manta tiene 34 años está casada con José. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi desde hace 7 años. Tienen 3 hijos estudiantes de escuela fiscal. Ella nos cuenta que su negocio lo empezó a medida de que no encontraba trabajo. Por ello decidió empezar el comercio de ropa. Nos comenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que su negocio le ayuda a los gastos de su hogar. Realiza el trabajo todos los días visitando a sus amigas o conocidas desde la mañana hasta la tarde, nos cuenta que su dificultad son las inseguridades de la calle y los recorridos que realiza ya que algunas calles son difíciles de transitar porque no están pavimentadas. El préstamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de mercadería lencería, blusas, etc. Su sueño es tener más clientes para hacer crecer su negocio como vendedora y terminar de construir su casa para darle una mejor vida a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Miriam lives in Manta, is 34 years old, and is married to José. Her husband has worked as a taxi driver for the past seven years. They have three children in public school. She tells us that she began her business because she couldn't find a job. As a result, she decided to get into clothing sales. She tells us that it has been going very well and her business now helps her to pay the expenses for her home. She works every day, visiting her friends and acquaintances from early in the morning until late in the afternoon, and she tells us that her difficulties include the insecurities of the street and the routes that she travels as some of the streets are difficult to get around on given that they are not paved. She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as lingerie and blouses, etc. Her dream is to have more clients to grow her business as a saleswoman, and she would also like to finish constructing her house in order to give a better life to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as lingerie and blouses

loans.name: C 8090 Icyizere Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 33 years old and married. She sells various foods such as beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. She has been in this business for four years. She is the leader of this group, which is called "C 8090 Icyizere" in her local language. In English, it means "Having confidence." She is in the dark red dress in the middle. 

Jeanne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various foods such as beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to sell. She will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various foods such as beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joevie

texts.en: 45-year-old Joevie is a married man with two children, ages 18 and 20. He supports his family through his sari-sari (variety) store business. He sells snack foods, toiletries, canned goods and other items. Joevie works hard to increase his income and be able to sustain his children's college education. He requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, vegetables and canned goods. This will help Joevie attract more customers and increase his sales. Joevie hopes for his children to finish college and for his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, vegetables and canned goods

loans.name: Rockson

texts.en:
Rockson lives in Gardnersville and is 42 years old. Married with  three children between the ages of  4 and 15 that are in school and live at home, he is a high school graduate and  has a certificate in carpentry. He worked as a carpenter to start  this business where he sells alcoholic drinks. A problem that  he faces is the price of the drinks  because he buys the drinks in USD, and now the exchange  rate USD to  LD is too high. He enjoys the interaction between him and his customers. Whenever he doesn’t go to sell,  his customers get  angry with him. 

Most interestingly his business helps to pay his children's school fees and his rent. Having enough money to buy a piece of land and support his home  makes him proud of his business. He is asking for a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks to have the attention of his customers. His dream is to educate his wife and children and to attend college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks to have the attention of his customers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 53 years old, married and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Fe would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.en:
20 years ago, a woman by the name of Muharam began her own business. At first she sold children's clothing. Muharam carried out her mission perfectly and that’s why her business has developed year by year. She is as good at bringing up her children as at business. She has three children and all of them are as smart as Muharam. 

Muharam gave her first business to her elder son and began developing a new business for herself. Nowadays Muharam sells women's and men's clothing. Her goods have a lot of customers. She is married, she is a mother and a good friend, and also Muharam is a good business lady. Her aim is to buy goods for the new season and complete her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a dos de sus hijos menores de edad en distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio desde hace más de cinco años. Ella cría sus animales en corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Gracias a esta actividad ella es conocida en la zona donde reside. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

Fabiola desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y de alimento balanceado, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 35 year old mother that resides with her husband and her two young children in the farming district of Oyotún, an area dedicated to commerce, agriculture and raising cattle. Oyotún is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region. 

Fabiola has been making a living raising and selling small animals at her home for over five years. She raises her animals in pens placed in the back of her home and when they reach a good size, she offers them to the merchants in the area. Thanks to this business, she is well known in her residential area. The income she makes with this activity is used to support her husband with the everyday household expenses of the family. 

Fabiola wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and balanced food. To reach her goal, she thought it would be suitable to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to Edpyme Alternativa. She is a responsible woman with a lot of drive to get ahead. She is grateful in advance to all the people that will support her through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced food to expand the business of raising and selling them.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, 45, who is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sonny, a driver, and she is a mother to four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for the future of her children.

Rose operates a community pharmacy store. She sells basic medicine and vitamins to the community. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Aside from this, she operates a tricycle and sells mineral water for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional medicine and mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rose hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional medicine and mineral water needed in her business

loans.name: Capulines Group

texts.es:
El grupo de los “capulines” se encuentra en un lujar muy alejado ya que para llegar al lugar es caminando ya que no hay trasporte para llegar es un muy grande la comunidad donde la gente se dedica al cultivo de maíz. El nombre lo eligieron porque el lugar donde se reúnen hay muchos capulines son un grupo pequeño pero que la gente aprovecha para hacer grandes cosas como atole de capulín, tamal de capulín etc.
Las integrantes del grupo son todas mujeres muy ocupadas con muchos compromisos ya que le día que las vistamos tenían agenda das ya otras actividades como atender sus negocios, reunión de la escala con sus niños etc.
Quien nos regalo la entrevista amablemente fue la señora María de los Remedios quien nos conto que tiene 51 años de edad esta casad con el señor Alfredo desde hace 34 años juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos que ya son independientes de dicha pareja nos cuenta que por el momento solo apoya a su hija que es mama soltera mientras su hija trabaja en la ciudad de México, Doña Remedios cuida de su nieto.
También nos cuenta que ella se dedica ha realizar mandiles de tela los mandiles son típicos de la región, los colores típicos son roas, verde fosforescente, rojo, azul etc. Esta vez ha solicitado el Doña Remedios comento “Yo aprendí desde muy chica hacer nahuas faldas que son típicas de la región como se muestra en la foto son faldas con mucho vuelo , entonces su como decidió hacer mandiles, estos mandiles se ponen encima de las nahuas nos cuenta que lleva ya 25 años haciendo los mandiles y lo inicio cuando su esposo le compro una máquina para cocer cuenta que ella no sabia hacer estos mandiles sin embrago su suegra si sabía hacer los mandiles pero nunca le quiso enseñar, Doña Remedios intento hacerlos por ella misma y mediante la practica le quedan muy bien ya que nos cuenta que no tiene ninguna dificultad para venderlos porque los clientes llegan solos a su casa para comprarles.
La dificultad que presenta es que la maquina que ocupa para hacer sus mandiles esta descuenta pero con el crédito que recibe  si le sobra arreglara su maquina aunque por el momento no tiene maquina en el futuro quiere arreglar el cuarto donde realiza sus mandiles adaptarla como sastrería                                                                                                                                                                                                   aunque considera que es muy difícil es muy ya que la tela es muy cara sin embargo sus ganancias las invierte en su tela y también para ahorrar y hacer realidad su sueño.
Doña Remedios y el resto del grupo esta muy contentas ya que podrán invertir en sus negocios  y atreves de sus ganancias su calidad de vida mejore para cada una de ellas y para su familia. Como  Filomena invertirá en una res, mientras que María Sabina, Josefina, Socorro, Esperanza, Angélica, comparar borregos. Liliana surtirá una tienda de abarrotes y Viviana en recuerdos para fiestas.
texts.en:
The group "Capulines" is found in a very remote area that you can only reach by food since there is no transportation to this community. Most of the people here cultivate corn. They chose their group name because where they meet there are a lot of capulines [a type of cherry]. They are a small group, but they take advantage of the opportunity to do big things like making cherry atole [a corn-based drink], cherry tamales, etc. 

The members of the group are all very busy women with a lot of commitments - the day we visited them they had a lot on their agenda including tending to their businesses, school meetings, etc.

We interviewed the friendly Maria de los Remedios, 51, who has been married to Alfredo for 34 years. Together they have 4 children who are already grown. They still support their daughter who is a single mother - Remedios takes care of their grandchild while her daughter works in Mexico City.

She tells us that she makes aprons that are typical of the region, in traditional colors like pink, green, neon yellow, red, blue, etc. She says "I learned from very young to make Nahua skirts that are typical of the region, as shown in the picture they are very full skirts and are therefore referred to as aprons. They are put on top of the skirts." she has been making the aprons for 25 years, starting when her husband bought her a sewing machine. She said that before, she didn't know how to make them but her mother-in-law did and didn't want to teach her. Remedios tried to make them herself, and with practice they started to turn out well and she has no trouble selling them because customers come on their own to her house to buy them.

Her difficulty is that her sewing machine is broken, but if she has leftover money from the loan she will fix it. Even though she doesn't have a sewing machine right now, in the future she wants to fix up the room where she sews and make it into a seamstress workshop. She thinks that it's very difficult because fabric is expensive, but nevertheless she invests her earnings in fabric and is also able to save to make her dream a reality.

Remedios and the rest of the group are very happy because they can invest in their businesses and improve their lives, and their families, with their profits. Filomena will buy an ox, while Maria Sabina, Josefina, Socorro, Esperanza and Angelica will buy sheep. Liliana will stock her grocery store and Viviana will buy party favors.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Jose Honorio

texts.es: Desde Duran conocemos a José un carpintero de 47 años. Hace 12 años decidió emplear todos sus conocimientos de manera independiente abriendo su propio local. El negocio de la carpintería es de familia ya que su papá fue quien le enseño a tratar la madera hasta lograr el producto final como lo son camas, cómodas, juego de salas y demás. Ahora le toca a él ya que sus hijos le ayudan en el local. Su esposa Flor se dedica a la venta de ropa. José nos cuenta que le gusta el trabajo que realiza y es muy conocido por el mismo. Actualmente nos indica que tiene problemas de visión y que uno de los principales motivos es la pelusa que sale al cepillar la madera, se debe a que no cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias para este proceso. De igual manera continua adelante y el préstamo lo empleara en la compra de madera para su proceso. Su sueño es tener un local más amplio con todas las herramientas para hacer más fácil su trabajo.
texts.en: In the city of Duran we meet Jose, who is a 47 year-old carpenter.  Twelve years ago, he decided to put his knowledge to work by opening up his own shop where he could work independently.  Carpentry is a family business, because his father was the one who taught him to work with wood and make final products such as beds, dressers, living room sets, and other items.  Now it's his turn, and he is working in his shop with his children.  His wife Flor has a business selling clothing.  Jose tells us that he enjoys the work that he does and he is well known for it.  He says that he is currently having some problems with his vision, and one of the main reasons is the lint that comes out when he is brushing the wood, because he doesn't have the tools he needs for this process.  But he continues ahead in the same way, and he will use this loan to buy wood to process.  His dream is to have a bigger shop with all of the tools that he needs to make his work easier.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: Angel vive en Libertad junto a su familiar, vive con sus padres ya que no ha tenido posibilidades para adquirir una casa propia. En su barrio cuentan con los servicios básicos pero no tiene caminos pavimentados de momento. Angel tiene un pequeño taller de reparación de motos y bicicletas, nos cuenta que tiene clientela por que pocas personas se dedican a este tipo de trabajo en la actualidad. La mecánica la aprendió desde muy pequeño ayudando a su papa, le enseño a reparación  y el trato que se les debe dar a los clientes. Pasando un tiempo decidió abrirse camino propio ya que formo su familia y debía mejorar sus ingresos. Nos comenta que ahora trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, trabaja en ese horario porque el taller está ubicado junto a su domicilio. Angel nos comenta que espera no tener competencia por su sector ya que le va bien y le genera el ingreso necesario para su familia. El espera con el crédito comprar repuestos y una bomba para mejorar la vulcanizadora. También nos indica que su esposa Angela se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y le ayuda con la economía. Tiene 3 hijos quienes tienen 5, 4 y 2 años y son estudiantes de la escuela fiscal.
texts.en: Angel lives in Libertad with his family - he lives with his parents as he has not yet had the possibility to get his own home. His neighborhood has all the basic services but it does not have paved roads at the moment. Angel has a small motorcycle and bicycle repair shop, and he tells us that he has many clients because there are very few people who currently do this kind of work. He has learned how to be a mechanic from a young age by helping his father, who taught him not only how to repair but also about the kind of treatment that he should give to his clients. A little while ago he decided to find his own path as he was starting a family and he needed to improve his income. He tells us that now he works from Monday through Sunday, from 8 in the morning until 7 at night, and he is able to work these hours because the shop is located next to his home. Angel tells us that he hopes to not face any further competition in this sector because things are going well and he is generating enough income for his family. With this loan, he will buy parts and a pump to improve tire repairs. He also tells us that his wife Angela works in the sale of products by catalog, and by doing so she helps him with their income. They have three children who are 5, 4, and 2 years old, and who are students in public school.

loans.use: to buy parts and a pump

loans.name: Chaleo

texts.en:
Chaleo is a widow and has no children. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. 

For the past five years, Chaleo has operated a dry-fish selling business. She also generates additional income by selling farm produce of cashew nuts and coconuts. Chaleo has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more bundles of fish, cooking oil and charcoal. 

Chaleo sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Likoni town to her shop. Chaleo hope to see her business expand; she would like to become a wholesaler of fish and to start a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of fish, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: C 8039 Wisigarinyuma Mubyeyi Group

texts.en:
Vanessa is 34 years old and has four children. She sells various food such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. and she has three years in this work. She is the leader of this group, which is called "C 8039 WISIGARINYUMA" MUBYEYI in the local language which means in English "Do not go behind mother" and she is in the white T-shirt on the right side and she is the first person. 

Vanessa has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various foods such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. for re-sale. She will be able to save for her future and she will be able to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various foods such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Ma. Hydee

texts.en:
Ma. Hydee is 38 years old and is a married woman with a 4-year-old child. She has had a sari-sari store for three years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month selling items like snack foods, soy sauce, vinegar and canned goods. Ma. Hydee does her best to give the best service to her customers and keep them loyal to her store. One of her goals is to make improvements to her family's house. 

She plans to use her loan to buy additional items to sell such as toiletries, noodles and snack foods. Ma. Hydee hopes her loan will help increase her income and enable her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as toiletries, noodles and snack foods

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de  52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope. Esta zona es considerada una de las mas pobres de la región Lambayeque y es a su vez una de las mas tradicionales. Sus pobladores son gente bastante humilde y trabajadora.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales. En la parte posterior de su casa tiene instalados varios corrales en los que cría animales menores como pavos, patos, pollos, etc. Y también ganado caprino y porcino. Cuando estos se han desarrollado correctamente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Adicionalmente realiza labores como peón agrícola, por lo cual percibe un ingreso semanal. Gracias a estas actividades el sostiene la precaria economía de su familia.

Tomás desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de modo que pueda obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

El ha tenido anteriormente un crédito con Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron. Aprovecha también esta ocasión para agradecer de antemano la ayuda de las personas que le apoyarán con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomás is 52 years old and a father.  He lives with his wife and son in one of the settlements that make up the rural district of Mórrope.  This zone is considered to be one of the poorest in the Lambayeque region, but at the same time is one of the most traditional.  Its people are very humble and hardworking.

He raises and sells livestock and has some pens set up behind his house where he raises small animals, like turkeys, ducks, chickens, etc.  He also raises livestock like goats and pigs.  When they have developed correctly, he offers them for sale to buyers in the zone.  He also works as a field hand, for which he receives a weekly salary.  Thanks to these activities, he is able to support the family’s precarious finances.

Tomás would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed to expand his livestock business so that he can increase his income and improve his quality of life.  In order to reach his objective he has found it in his interest to request a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

He has had a previous loan from Kiva and he is very grateful to those who supported him.  He also wants to use this opportunity to thank those who supported him.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es: Desde Duran conocemos a Raúl quien tiene 49 años. El está casado con Rosa quien le ayuda  con su negocio y esta al cuidado de sus 2 hijos quienes estudian en escuelas fiscales. Desde niño el papá de Raúl fue quien le enseño  todo sobre camiones y mecánica siendo esta la actividad que actualmente realiza. El trabajo lo realiza en su domicilio todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche ya que es fundamental en sus ingresos. Raúl nos cuenta que uno de sus temores en su negocio es la delincuencia, ya que tiene herramienta que son caras y útiles, como es maquinaria grande no la puede guardar por lo tanto queda al aire convirtiéndose así en objeto de robo. Con el préstamo va a comprar grasa, herramientas y productos para tener en inventario. Su sueño es poder tener un taller más amplio en el centro de Duran y llegar a poner sucursales…
texts.en: Raul is 49 years old and is from Duran, Ecuador. He is married to Rosa who helps him with his business and with caring for their two children who study in public school. Since he was a child, Raul's father was the one who taught him everything about trucks and how to be a mechanic, and this is the work he currently does. He does this work from his home every day, from morning until night, as it is a fundamental part of his income. Raul tells us that one of his biggest fears with his business is delinquency, as he has many expensive and useful tools like large machinary which he is not able to store inside, which makes them potential targets of robbery. With this loan he will buy grease, tools, and products to have in inventory. His dream is to be able to have a larger shop in the center of Duran, and later to be able to have various branches of his business.

loans.use: to buy grease and tools

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Maria vive en el sur de Guayaquil conocido como el Guasmo. Su casa a pesar de estar en un sector donde falta mucha atención del gobierno cuenta con los servicios básicos y es de cemento, no es propia ya que vive con sus padres. Maria tiene 26 años de edad se encuentra separa y tiene un hijo quien está en la escuela fiscal del barrio. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas. Este trabajo lo viene haciendo hace 7 años atrás, le gusta mucho la cocina y le da muy buenos resultados. Nos comenta que se siente muy contenta de realizar algo que verdaderamente le gusta sobre todo cuando la alaban por su sazón lo cual lo demuestran ya que sus cliente regresan. Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su madre quien fue la que le enseño la preparación de los alimentos. Como es madre soltera su mayor preocupación seria enfermarse ya que su hijo tiene 6 añitos y depende de ella. Maria piensa ampliar el negocio por eso realiza el préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, arroz por quintales, platos.
texts.en: Maria lives in the south of Guayaquil known as Guasmo. Her house, despite being in an area that lacks a lot of government attention, has basic services and is made of cement, but it is not her own as she lives with her parents. Maria is 26 years old, separated, and has a son who goes to the local public school. She works in the preparation and sale of fast food. She has been doing this for the past 7 years, and she very much likes to cook and it gives her good results. She tells us that she feels very happy being able to do something that she truly likes, especially when people praise her food and her clients keep coming back for more. She does this work in the company of her mother who was the one who taught her how to prepare her dishes. As she is a single mother her greatest worry is that she will become sick, since her 6 year old son depends on her. Maria would like to grow her business, and as such would like this loan to buy chairs, tables, rice in bulk and plates.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, rice in bulk, and plates

loans.name: J. Fofie

texts.en: J. Fofie lives in Gardnersville with his two children and girlfriend. He is 37 years old. He is a junior student at a university. When asked, "How did you start this business?" J. Fofie smiles and says, "I sold biscuits and later got involved in farming. I planted some seeds that were harvested three times a year. The money generated was used to establish a shop where I am now selling rice and flour by the bag. For four years now, I have been operating this shop." Some problems he faces are the road condition to his shop and low income, because he wants to open another store in the market. He says his business has brought him respect and pride. Today, his family depends on him for help, since he is the most successful one in his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of rice, flours, and oil for his business. His plans are to see his two children attend a university, establish another shop, and improve some of his family members' lives.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of rice, flours, and oil for his business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia  lives in Bardnersville, is married and has three children ages 6, 10 and 20, that live with her and attend school. Her husband is an inspector of the Ministry of Finance. She was able to manage her husband's salary so as to have a local block factory, running  for the past five years now. She says there are lots of challenges in said business, but the biggest is that customers don’t pay on time and sometimes she has not enough water to mix the  cement, especially during the dry season. 

She likes  how popular  and busy she is. Most interestingly, she makes more profit at this time. She said she will always give thanks to her father for the trade he has given her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and water to improve her  business.  She said, "My dreams are many. In the near future I want to build a very big guest  house and  open a grocery store."

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and water to improve her  business

loans.name: C 8081 Turikumwe Group

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 26 years old and is married with three children. He sells beds, chairs, etc. Jean Marie Vianney is the leader of this group which is called "C 8081 TURIKUMWE" in the local language which means in English "WE ARE TOGETHER". In the photo, he's the one who has a paper in his hand. This is his sixth year in this business and he works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily except on the weekend. Jean Marie Vianney currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy materials for making more bed, chairs, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children, and to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more beds, chairs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Junoise

texts.en: Ma. Junoise is a married woman with four children aged between 11 and 26 years. Her husband works as a carpenter. Ma. Junoise supports her family through her sari-sari (variety) store business. She works hard to increase her daily income and save for her children's education. She applied for a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. Ma. Junoise hopes to have increased sales and profitability. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has one child who attends school. She does not take care of other additional family members.  She operates a retail shop that she rents.  She works six days a week and has been in this business for seven years.

Agnes is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, rice, cartons of salt, soap, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include transportation and the increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale business and to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes rent for business premises and food.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La socia Hilaria nació en el distrito de Lamay de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente ella vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca, ella tiene 27 años, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. La socia Hilaria se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores y a la ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. La socia Hilaria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales como pasto, concentrados y otras cosas más. La socia Hilaria sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The group-member Hilaria was born in the district of Lamey in the province of Calca, department of Cusco but she now lives in the Huchuy Qosqo community in the province of Calca. She is 27 years old, is married and the fruit of her wonderful marriage are four children. 

Hilary continues working raising small animals and cattle. She has now been working in this business for many years and it is going very well thanks to her work. 

Hilary is asking for a loan to buy food for the animals such as feed, concentrate and other things. Hilary remains a member of the communal bank “Huchuy Qosqo” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy food for the animals such as feed, concentrate and other things.

loans.name: El Limoncito Group

texts.es:
El grupo "El Limoncito" está ubicado en frente de una presa que, aunque poca, aún tiene agua. El lugar donde se encuentra "El Limoncito" se llama Nenaxi, un lugar donde la gente es muy humilde y trabajadora. El grupo está conformado por nueve mujeres muy trabajadoras. Ellas mismas eligieron el título del grupo ya que en el lugar donde se reunían anteriormente había un pequeño árbol de limón.

Doña Benita quien es la representante del grupo, ya había estado anteriormente en la agrupación, pero ahora vuelve a integrarse. Benita nos cuenta que tiene 57 años de edad está casada con el Señor Miguel y juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, aunque apenas inició con el negocio, comenta que no ha tenido ninguna dificultad hasta el momento. Menciona que el crédito le será de gran ayuda porque podrá comprar maíz y gas ya que en la actualidad los precios de los productos son muy altos. A Doña Benita le gustaría que su negocio creciera "Pero lo que más me gustaría, es llegar a ser la mejor tortillera en Nenaxi y también me gustaría que mi calidad de vida mejore económicamente". 

Doña Benita y las demás integrantes del grupo están muy contentas y agradecidas con Vision Fund (FRAC) y Kiva por el crédito otorgado ya que cada una podrá invertir en las actividades que ya estaban desempeñando. La otra integrante que se une al grupo es María Almita quien invertirá su crédito en borregos.
texts.en:
The group "El Limoncito" ("The Little Lime") is located in front of a dam, which still has water, even if just a little. The area where "El Limoncito" finds itself is called Nenaxi, a place where people are very humble and hardworking. The group is composed of nine very hardworking women. They chose the name of the group themselves, as the place where they used to meet had a little lime tree. 

Doña Benita who is the representative of the group, was previously in the group and has recently returned to it. Benita tells ust hat she is 57 years old, married to Miguel, and together they have a family with seven children. She works in the making of tortillas, and though she recently started the business she tells us that she has not had any difficulties up until now. She mentions that the credit will be of great help to her because she will be able to buy corn and gas as current prices for these products are very high.
