Doña Benita would like her business to grow, "but more then anything I would like to become the best tortilla maker in Nenaxi and I would also like for my quality of life to improve economically."

Doña Benita and the other members of the group are very happy and grateful for Vision Fund (FRAC) and Kiva for the loans provided, as each member will be able to invest in the activities that they were already performing. The other new member of this group is María Almita, who will use her loan to invest in sheep.

loans.use: to buy corn and other ingredients

loans.name: La Palma De Calmeca Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes son la joven Arcelia va a comprar con su prestamo productos naturales por kit Herbalife, la señora Elena va a comprar semillas, cominos, clavos, almendra, cacahuate, semilla de calabaza. La joven Arcelia tiene 19 años de edad ella es soltera sin niños, ella tiene su club nutricional, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar productos nutricionales Herbalife, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años como veia que en su familia hacian falta recursos económicos decidio emprender este negocio, ella compro sus productos con la ultima beca que recibió cuando estudio en Bachilleres, su negocio es importante para cuidar la salud de las personas, a ella le gusta ayudarles a sus clientas con buenos consejos de nutrición, ella se siente orgullosa de que sus productos les ayuden a su salud y cuando llegan nuevos clientes que le van recomendando, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar nuevos productos para incrementar el negocio y así dar mejor servicio al cliente. Su negocio le ha ayudado a su familia le da a su mama para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanza son crecer su negocio tener más clientes e inscribir a más personas en otras comunidades. Las integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Visión Fund por sus préstamos gracias a ustedes podemos crecer los negocio y podemos vivir mejor con la familia.
texts.en: The new members of this group are Arcelina, who is going to buy natural products from Herbalife with this loan, and Elena, who is going to buy seeds, including cumin, clove, almond, peanut, and pumpkin seeds.  Young Arcelina, 19, is single and has no children.  She has a nutritional club, and she is requesting this loan to buy nutritional Herbalife products.  She decided to start her business 2 years ago, seeing that her family was lacking financial resources.  She bought her products with the last scholarship she received when she was in high school.  Her business is important because it helps people to care for their health.  She enjoys helping her customers by giving them good nutritional advice.  She feels proud that her products help people's health, and when new customers arrive she provides recommendations for them.  She is content with this loan that she is going to receive, because it will enable her to buy new products to increase her business so that she can provide better service to her customers.  Her business has helped her family, because she is able to give her mother money to buy food.  Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business to have more customers and enroll more people in other communities.  The members of this group give thanks to Kiva and to the Vision Fund for these loans.  Thanks to you, they will be able to grow their businesses and live better with their families.

loans.use: to purchase Herbalife products

loans.name: Veronica Jean

texts.en:
This is Veronica, 50, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leopoldo, a driver, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Veronica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells rugs for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Veronica hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma , 48, is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alex, a driver, and a mother to her children. By the grace of God and with the help of her supportive husband, she can provide for the needs of her children. She is able to do so by means of her business enterprise, a small computer and arcade shop. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, not all families can afford to buy personal computers, portable play stations, or equipment for video games. Children only enjoy this kind of amusement by renting at computer arcades and they pay per hour of usage. Alma has several arcade units and she earns PHP 400 per day. 

To help her continue to run her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. She expects to boost her business income as she expands her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is an artisan who specializes in tooled leather furniture. He has identified the following potential areas of investment:
to purchase raw materials for production such as properly seasoned wood and high quality leather. 
to purchase new tools or equipment for the workshop, including a router table and a stand on which to varnish the pieces.

Abel has been selling through NOVICA since 1999. This is his story:

Abel has been crafting leather items since he was 16. His older brother, Hector, taught him. "When I was 23, I opened my own workshop in my house," Abel says. "I cut and tool fine leather with a distinct style and skill that you won't find in many workshops. I design many beautiful Inca and colonial motifs, and emboss those upon the leather. I am especially happy and proud that my products are being sold all over the world now through the internet."

"I am so excited to have this opportunity to borrow funds through Kiva for the first time. Life is constantly offering us learning opportunities. I feel so proud to know that something that my family and I have created with our hands can become a part of someone's home – wherever they are in the world! That gives me such a sense of satisfaction. And now I'm thankful for this opportunity to reach new lenders who can offer their support from around the world. Thank you for considering this microcredit."

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, new tools and equipment

loans.name: C 2599 Urukondo Group

texts.en:
Seraphine is 42 years old and is a widow. She takes care of two relatives. She sells goods such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. and she has ten years in this work. She is the leader of this group, which is called "C 2599 URUKONDO" in the local language which means in English "LOVE" and she is the one who has a paper in her hand. She currently employs one person to help her. Her business is open from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily every week. 

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more goods such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale. She will be able to save for her future and she will be able to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as: beans, potatoes, bananas, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 56-year-old married man with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for over thirty years. He says that teaching was his childhood passion and he feels he has been able to realise his dream although he earns a low salary of 300,000 shillings per month.

His personal goal is to educate his children up to higher institutions and he also plans to start a produce business since he is almost retiring. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his child who is entering the university.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 39 years old and lives Compound #3. She is married and has three children from 2 to 12 years old. Two children are in school and all live at home. For the past two years, she been selling oil, pepper, bitter ball and rice. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys the flow of her customers. Annie is  requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, bitter ball and rice for her business. One problem she facing is the rainy season affecting her business. She wants her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pepper, bitter ball and rice for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, 48, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Agripina, a housewife, and father to his children, who are all employed. With his wife and children, he manages their household while operating a processed meat business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

The processed meat store is where one can buy processed and frozen meat like hot dogs, ham, and the like. Felix buys processed meat at wholesale prices and sells retail by the kilo. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Felix hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy processed and frozen meat products for his business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 39 years old and lives in Gardnersville. He’s married and his wife is a businesswoman; they have a child aged 9 months. 

For eight years Andrew has been operating a electronics store where he sells and repairs video, tapes, video desk, etc. Most interestingly, he has many customers since he is the only one in his community who  professionally  repairs electronics accessories. Some problems he is facing are:  the parts for the repair items  are difficult to find  and customers are not willing to pay for the parts used on the items. 

Andrew is requesting a loan to purchase more parts for video, tapes, computer, video desk, and used electronic accessories (video, video desk, tapes, radio, computer,  car and bike batteries, light ball, wirer) for his business. His plan is to open an additional branch in the near future and educate his child.

loans.use: to purchase more parts for video, tapes, computer, video desk, as well as used electronic accessories for his business

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son, who is over 18 years old, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Maysaa is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother to five sons. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs and his sons’ education expenses.

Maysaa has her own project. She also has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products. This has been a profitable project, but also needs more support.

Maysaa is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income so they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her business. She sells various kinds of merchandise, such as women's dresses and baby clothes, which she delivers to each customer according to what the customer has ordered from her. She sells on credit and gets back her investment weekly, biweekly, or monthly, depending on the agreement with her customer. 

She started working as a merchant seven years ago. As she wants to continually improve her business, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her business' turnover increases, such as the middle of the year. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her third financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. 

With the loan, she will buy merchandise, such as elegant dresses and shoes, to fill her customers' orders and make sure they have the best.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as elegant dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en: Tawah is 42 years old and lives in compound #3. She did not go to school but married and has seven children between  12 and 27 years old. They live at home and are in school. Her husband is a businessman. For the past fifteen years,  she has been involved in business. Currently she sells shoes. She says she likes how fast her business goes, but  the problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes  to expand her business. Her plan is to build her house and  educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  more shoes  to expand her business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is married to Njoroge. Her husband works as a civil servant and they have two children aged five and ten years old. She dreams of becoming a successful, professionally fulfilled woman. Her children are the motivation to work persistently every day to create conditions that will lead to a better well-being.

Anne works at two activities. On the one hand she offers beauty services and on the other she makes fruit juices for sale. She learned both activities three years ago and it was in 2010 that she started to use them to earn income.

Her clientele are neighbors, friends, family members and people referred by current customers. The sale of natural juice takes place nearby her place of operation and she is able to monitor both businesses. She works as a stylist whenever her clientele requires it.

Her goal is to become a professional stylist and to expand her profit margin investing to attract more customers but her working capital is her greatest challenge to reach this dream. This is the reason why she’s requesting her Kiva loan, her first financing from Yehu Microfinance Trust, that she’ll use to buy beauty supplies and modern equipment like a hair straightening iron and a hair dryer. She will also buy fruit to continue strengthening her two income-producing businesses she plans to use to improve her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and modern equipment like a hair straightening iron and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members (her grandchildren).

She operates a food stall at the market and operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava, and bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns other stalls in the same market. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes, cassava, Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa e hijos, él es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado por completo a sacar adelante a su familia; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver un poco de televisión juntamente con su familia y en algunas ocasiones prepara una riquísima “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” para engreír a su familia y compartir gratos momentos.   
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja como maestro de obras en diversas construcciones, el dedica gran parte de su tiempo a su negocio, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diaras, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debidos a los buenos acabados, esmero y dedicación que brinda en sus trabajos.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un cerco de concreto para acabar su sala, así también podrá mejorar la fachada de su casa; de esta manera podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto desea y podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old, and lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and children. He is a very hardworking man, who is dedicated to providing for his family. In his free time, he likes to watch a bit of television with his family, and on some occasions, he likes to cook up a delicious, "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (a typical, thick pasta sauce and dish with noodles) to spoil his family and share special moments.

A dedicated and consistent worker, José makes a living as a construction manager, spending much of his time at his business. He works about 10 hours per day, and believes that his business is going well because of the high quality work he does and the care and attention to detail that he brings to all his construction jobs.

José is grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their support he will be able to finish building a room in his house, and also repair the front facade of his family's home. He hopes these improvements will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to complete improvements and repairs to his home.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y sociable. Su pareja es Rosendo, quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen cuatro hijos: Erick de 25 años, Rosendo de 19, Winy de 17 y Manolo de 11 años. Viven en la casa que es de su propiedad por herencia de sus padres.
Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería. Cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su vivienda, ahorrándose gastos de alquiler de local. Es muy concurrida, pues cuenta con un stock muy variado. Lleva en este negocio 10 años, contando con la ayuda de su hijo en la atención a los clientes. Le gusta su trabajo por contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, además que la distrae, le gusta tener su propio capital de trabajo y sentirse independiente. Lo que no le gusta es que la calle no es asfaltada y al pasar los vehículos levantan polvo que se acumula en sus andamios, teniendo bastante trabajo en limpiar  todos los días. Pero eso no la desanima y deseo ampliar, hacer crecer y continuar su negocio.
Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente cómoda con su grupo, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de artículos de ferretería al por mayor, así como también en repuestos para motos. Buscará precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elva, age 54, is a hardworking and decisive woman. She is also cheerful and sociable. Her partner Rosendo is a merchant and they have four children: Erick (age 25), Rosendo (age 19), Winy (age 17), and Manolo (age 11). They live in a house that she inherited from her parents.

Elva sells hardware goods from a store that is set up in her home, which prevents her from paying rent on a shop. Her business is busy with activity and is stocked with various products. She has been in this business for 10 years and her son helps with attending to the customers. Elva enjoys her work because it generates an income that helps her partner with the household expenses and it also provides a distraction for her. She enjoys having her own capital because it makes her feel independent. What she dislikes is the fact that her business is located along a road that is not paved. Therefore, the vehicles that drive by stir up dust that accumulates on her shelves, so she is left having to clean every day. Elva is not discouraged and wants to continue and expand her business.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP organization. She is pleased to have financial support for advancing her business. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her payments, just as she was with her previous loans. Elva feels comfortable with her group because she considers them to be responsible and supportive people. The loan amount of 2,500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy hardware goods in bulk. She will also buy motorcycle parts. Elva looks for the most affordable price, so she buys in volume in order to generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy hardware goods and motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Rosa Marieta

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive por  los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, su situación geográfica es muy accidentada y nos brinda hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, dos de sus hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad y una hija pasa en casa ayudándole a los quehaceres del hogar. Su esposo es de profesión ebanista y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa pasa el mayor de su tiempo en casa  y labora hace 23 años en el taller con su esposo, labora de lunes a sábados sin horario. También se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos y conejos, tiene sembríos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y si existe sobrante lo vende.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 13 años y esta muy agradecida ya que con los créditos ha podido solventar los estudios a sus hijos, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes.
 
Su meta es tener más sembríos en sus terrenos para tener mayor variedad de productos  para la venta.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Nueva Amistad Communal Bank.  She lives near the outskirts of Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place that has a cold climate.  Its geographic location is very rugged and offers beautiful landscapes to enjoy nature.  The residents raise animals and farm, and still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

Rosa, 49, is married and has six children from this relationship, all adults.  Three of them are married and live on their own.  Two of her children are studying in the university in the city and one daughter stays at home helping her with the housework.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker by trade and works in his own shop.  They live in their own house.
 
Rosa spends the majority of her time at home.  She has worked for 23 years in her husband's workshop, from Monday through Friday without a fixed schedule.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, and rabbits.  She has fields that she harvests for home consumption and sells anything that is left over.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 13 years and is very grateful because she has been able to pay for her children's studies with the loans.  She is going to invest her new loan in buying chickens and guinea pigs.

Her goal is to plant more on her land to have a greater variety of crops to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Cristian Maria

texts.es: Cristian Maria soltera de 51 años de edad tiene por actividad economica la venta de cosmeticos a la cual se ha dedica desde hace varios años, lo cual cuenta con mucha experiencia, en la actualidad Cristian ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora, con solvencia moral, el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo como: productos de belleza, crema faciales, mascarillas, cremas antiarrugas, crema antiojeras entre otros.
texts.en: Cristian Maria, 51, has a business selling cosmetics.  She has had this business for a number of years, and has a lot of experience with it.  Cristian has demonstrated herself to be responsible, hardworking and of good character.  She needs this loan to invest in working capital such as: beauty products, face creams, beauty masks, anti-wrinkle creams, anti-aging creams, and other products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, facial creams, beauty masks, anti-wrinkle creams, anti-aging creams, and other products

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa, además de decidida y alegre. Su pareja es Clever, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos: Greicy de 21 años, Clever de 17, César de 14, Nair de 8 y Silvia de 6 añitos. Habitan en la casa que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo.
Su actividad es la venta de comidas típicas de la localidad, como “Juanes” (un preparado de arroz envuelto en hojas), muy consumido, por ser tradicional; pero también prepara otros platillos. Silvia instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa por las tardes, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Lleva realizando este negocio desde hace 2 meses, logrando ver crecer su clientela. También cuenta con un trabajo como empleada doméstica por medio tiempo, desde hace 2 años. De esa manera logra contar con varios ingresos económicos. Considera a su negocio de venta de comida bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus platillos y su bajo costo, además de las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta contar con dos ingresos económicos para apoyar a su esposo, ya que con el ingreso de obrero no les alcanzaba, además de poder estar en casa para atender a sus pequeños hijos. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido, pues le dificulta la venta, pero eso no la desanima y tiene planes de hacer crecer y continuar con  su negocio.
Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP. Está agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Se siente a gusto con su grupo, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, buscando variar su carta de platillos, pues cree que a mayor variedad, tendrá mayor preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 41, is a very hard-working and diligent woman.  She is also dedicated and happy.  Her life partner is Clever, and they have five children, 21 year old Greicy, 17 year old Clever, 14 year old César, 8 year old Nair, and 6 year old Silvia.  They live in the house that they managed to buy with a great deal of effort.

Her business activity is selling food that is typical of her area.  She sells things like “Juanes” (prepared food with rice wrapped in leaves).  Because it is traditional, it is consumed a lot.  However, she also prepares other dishes.

In the afternoons she sets up a table in front of her house.  That is where she very kindly waits on her customers, most of whom are her neighbors.  She has been working in this business for two months, and she has managed to get more customers.  She has also had a job for two years working as a domestic employee half-time.  This way she counts on various financial incomes.  She feels that her business of selling food is very profitable because of the demand of the dishes and her low cost, in addition to the good income it produces.

She likes having two financial incomes in order to support her husband.  His income as a worker was not enough.  Also, she is able to be in her house to take care of her young children.

What she does not like is when it rains often because it makes sales difficult.  However, this does not discourage her.  She has plans to continue in her business and to make it grow.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her payments as she did with the previous loans.  She is comfortable with her communal bank, and she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy the supplies and ingredients that she needs to make her food.  She is looking to vary her menu of dishes.  She believes that with a greater variety she will have the loyalty of more customers.

loans.use: to buy the supplies and ingredients that she needs to make her food.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 64 años, es una mujer que le gusta el campo, trabajadora y empeñosa, además de dinámica y alegre. Está casada con Nicolás, con quien vive, junto a su hija de 20 años. Su casa es propia, pues le fue heredada por sus padres.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frijoles, plátanos y otros frutos. Para eso cuenta con un terreno ubicado en un caserío a las riveras del río, cedido por el gobierno, de tres hectáreas. Se dedica a esto hace más de 15 años, contando con la ayuda ocasional de peones, a quienes contrata por día trabajado en labores de cultivo, siembra y cosecha. Considera su actividad muy rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Y lo que le gusta es estar en el campo, en contacto con la naturaleza, oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Además que con los ingresos económicos que tiene apoya a su esposo (que es obrero) a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ahora se está recuperando de las pérdidas que le dejó la creciente del río. Pero por otro, lado, se siente contenta, ya que logra vender toda lo que produce. Debido a su edad, solo tiene planes de mantenerse en esta actividad.
Este es su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida por la línea de crédito que tiene, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse cómoda con el grupo del que forma parte, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la contratación de ocho peones para la preparación del terreno y siembra de maíz frejol, y posteriormente con ayuda de cuatro peones realizará la cosecha de su producción.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 64, is a hard-working, diligent, dynamic, and happy woman who likes the country.  She lives with her husband, Nicolás, and her 20 year old daughter.  The house is hers as she inherited it from her parents.

Her business activity is agriculture.  She grows corn, beans, bananas, and other fruit.  She has a field in a village on the banks of the river.  These three hectares were granted to her by the government.  She has been farming for over 15 years.  She has the occasional help of workers whom she hires for the day to do farm work like planting and harvesting.

She considers her business activity to be very profitable because of the good income it gives her.  She likes to be in the field and in contact with nature.  She learned farming from her parents.  Also, with the income she has she helps her husband (a worker) to pay for the household expenses.

She is now recovering from the losses that the rising river caused.  On the other hand, she is happy because she manages to sell all that she produces.  Due to her age, she only has plans to maintain this business activity.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments as she did with previous loans.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to hire eight day workers to prepare the land and to plant corn and beans.  Later, with the help of four people, she will harvest her production.

loans.use: to hire eight day workers to plant and harvest her next production of corn and beans.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia Timotea nació en el distrito de Coya de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente ella vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca. 

La socia Timotea se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores y ella también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo que realiza. La socia Timotea en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y para comprar por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. La socia Timotea sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Timotea was born in the district of Coya, in the province of Calca, department of Cusco. She presently lives in the community of Huchuy Qosgo, in the province of Calca.

Timotea makes a living raising small animals, and also runs a small grocery store. She started her business some time ago, and is doing very well, since she works very hard. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase small animals, such as guinea pigs, and to purchase sacks of rice and sugar. Timotea is a member of the community bank, "Huchuy Qosgo," which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase small animals, such as guinea pigs, and to purchase sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is single and lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. She operates a beauty parlor, where she offers manicures, pedicures, haircuts, blow-drys and styling for men, women and children. She is focused on improving her personal and professional image and on the tastes and preferences of the consumers of her services. 

At present, she is using her Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Yehu Microfinance Trust, to buy beauty products. She will buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and nail polish, etc. in greater volume. Every day she has more customers and she needs to have materials for her business to better respond to them and also to be able to sell to them once they have received her services. This is an added value her beauty parlor offers. 

Her dream for the future is to buy the locale where she is so that she doesn't have to pay rent anymore. While she is working on her dream, she continues to strive to increase her profit margin, which is no less than 25%.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana Rosa  casada con tres hijos menores de edad tiene como actividad economica una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion tiene tres años de tener el negocio, el negociolo inico con una pana vendiendo naranjas dulces, bananos y otro tipos de verduras luego compra una refrigeradora y comenzo a vender fresco en su casa en la actulidad tiene una pulpera bien surtida con productos de consumo diario para el hogar, el cual genera buenas utilidades ya que sigue creciendo, y gracias al apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado ha podido sacar adelante  en invertir en capital de trabajo, el finaciamiento lo quiere par la compra de : huevos, arroz , aceite, azucar, frijoles, pan, leche, tiste, entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Rosa is married and has 3 small children.  She has had a grocery store located in her house for 3 years.  She started out selling sweet oranges, bananas and other types of vegetables that she carried on a tray.  Later she bought a refrigerator and started to sell fresh juices from her house.  She now has a well-stocked grocery store where she sells consumer staples.  This business generates good profits and it continues to grow.  Thanks to the support that the Fundacion Leon 2000 has provided her, she has been able to get ahead and invest in working capital. She will use this loan to buy eggs, rice, cooking oil, sugar, beans, bread, milk, tiste [a traditional drink made from corn and cocoa], and other products.

loans.use: to buy eggs, rice, cooking oil, sugar, beans, bread, milk, and other products

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia Aleja nació en el distrito de Chichero de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente ella vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca. 

La socia Aleja se sigue dedicando a la venta de calzados para caballeros, damas y niños. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Aleja en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos para niños y damas. La socia Aleja sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Aleja was born in the district of Chichero, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. She presently lives in the community of Huchuy Qosgo, in the province of Calca.

Aleja makes a living selling footwear for men, women and children. She started this business some years ago, and she is doing very well, since she works very hard. Aleja is requesting this loan in order to purchase shoes for women and children. She is a member of the community bank, "Huchuy Qosgo," of the Arariwa Association, which is located in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase womens' and kids' shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна  работала в школе учителем начальных классов.  В последние 7 лет она  фермер.  Занимается выращиванием укропа, петрушки и щавеля.
Для облегчения труда и  чтобы не нанимать рабочих,  Анна решила приобрести культиватор для вспашки земли.   В селе,  в котором она проживает,  есть проблемы  с  электроэнергией. Поэтому ей нужен  дизельный генератор для бесперебойной подачи электроэнергии.

В ближайшее время у Анны есть желание расширить свои земельные участки,  а также построить теплицу  для раннего выращивания зелени укропа и петрушки.

В личных планах - покупка автомобиля  для перевозки товара на рынок.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования культиватора и генератора.
texts.en: Anna used to work as an elementary school teacher.  She has been a farmer during the last seven years.  She is involved in growing dill, parsley and sorrel.  To ease her work and not hire workers, Anna decided to purchase a cultivator for plowing land.  There are problems with electricity in the village, where she lives, and this is why she needs a diesel generator for continued supply of electricity.  In near future, Anna wants to expand her land plots and also to build a greenhouse for growing dill and parsley early.  Her personal plans include purchasing a car for transporting product to the market.  She needs your help with financing a cultivator and generator.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El  señor   Máximo es una persona  emprendedora  el cual  tiene un  negocio de tacos  al  vapor  en la localidad , nos  comenta  que el  numero  de  clientes  a  aumentado  satisfactoriamente lo  cual  le  permite  generar  un  ingreso  mayor, nos  comenta  que  en esta  ocasión se  acerco a la institución ya  que  desea  adquirir mobiliario  como sillas   y  mesas  ,  ya  que   actualmente  no  a   tenido la  posibilidad  de  realizar   la  compra, ve  en el  crédito la posibilidad  de  seguir    ofreciendo el  sazón y  el excelente servicio que  lo a  caracterizado  además de  que  sus  clientes  estarán  mas   cómodos, agradece  el  apoyo  para     la  realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Señor Máximo is an entrepreneurial person who has a vapor-cooked taco business in the neighborhood. He comments that the number of customers has increased satisfactorily, which allows him to generate a bigger income. He also tells us that now he is approaching the institution because he wants to acquire furniture such as chairs and tables, since now it is not possible for him to make the purchase (on his own). He sees in the loan the possibility of continuing to offer the good flavors and excellent service that has characterized his business, in addition to his customers being more comfortable. He is thankful for the support for the realization of his project.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es: Alma es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy responsable, se acerco a la institución ya  que  desea  realizar  la  compra  de   mercancía  para  su tienda  de abarrotes, ya  que  nos  comenta  que le  gusta   tener  disponible  los   diferentes    productos   cuando  sus  clientes  lo   requieren,  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  por  lo  que   se encuentra  muy  contenta agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Alma is a hardworking and responsible person who approached this institution because she wanted to purchase some merchandise for her grocery store.  She tells us that she likes having different products available when her customers need them.  She sees in this loan the possibility of making her business grow, and so she is very pleased with this support that will allow her to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es: La señora Silvestra  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora  quien se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años. Este negocio gracias a su arduo trabajo y los préstamos ha logrado mejorarlo e ir creciendo actualmente invertirá en bananos y naranjas.
texts.en:
Silvestra is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has sold fruits and vegetables for 20 years.  Thanks to her hard work and the loans, she has managed to improve this business and continue growing.

Currently she will invest in bananas and oranges.

loans.use: to buy bananas and oranges.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Alcadía quien tiene una tortillería y vende nacatamales desde hace 16 años. El crédito lo invertirá en maíz, frijoles, cerdo, especies y leña.
Las otras integrantes son Liliam quien trabaja como doméstica y vende cosméticos y Ángela vende chatarra, hierro y cobre desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
Alfa y Omega Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is María Alcadía, who makes tortillas and has sold "nacatamales" [Nicaraguan tamales] for 16 years.

The other members are Liliam, who works as a housekeeper and sells cosmetics, and Ángela, who has sold scrap metal, iron, and copper for 20 years.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork, spices, and firewood.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей занимается садоводством,  по хозяйству ему помогает 13-летний сын.
 На его дачном участке растут  виноград и деревья черешни. 
Приобретение мотоблока и сенокосилки необходимо Андрею для вспашки земли и уборки сорной травы на своих земельных участках.  Это значительно облегчит  его труд. 

У Андрея в ближайших планах - заняться выращиванием земляники,  подвести капельный полив  и  приобрести опрыскиватель.

В личных планах -  купить  автомобиль большей тоннажности  для перевозки собранного урожая на рынки.

Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока и сенокосилки.
texts.en: Andrey is involved in gardening, and his 13 year-old son helps him with it.  Grapes and cherry trees grows on his garden plot.  Andrey needs to purchase mechanized farming equipment and a mower for plowing the land and cleaning up grass weeds on his land plots.  This will significantly ease his work.  In the near future, Andrey plans to get involved in growing strawberries, install a drip irrigation system and purchase a sprayer.  His personal plans include purchase a large truck to transport his harvest to the markets.  Andrey needs your help with financing the farm equipment and mower.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Segundo José

texts.es: El señor Segundo José es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica desde hace 7 años en la compra y venta de cosechas principalmente de aguacate, plátano y mango negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con el fin de aumentarlo.
texts.en: Segundo José is a hard-working entrepreneur who has dedicated himself to the buying and selling of avocado, banana and mango crops. He will invest his loan into his crops in order to expand his business.

loans.use: buy banana, avocado and mango crops.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with thirteen children, and ten of them go to school. She takes care of other additional family members.

Betty sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last 18 years.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy watermelon, passion fruits, pineapples, oranges and mangoes. Her major business challenges are transportation, thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to educate her children up to university. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of watermelon, passion fruit, pineapple and oranges.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 29 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her four children who are between the ages of 1 and 10. Two are in school and they all live at home. Sarah stopped her education in the 4th grade, and for twelve years now she has been selling peppers, palm oil, okra, rice and other items in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes the profit she makes from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to buy more peppers, palm oil, okra, rice and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, palm oil, okra, rice and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anith

texts.es:
Anith tiene 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, además de alegre y extrovertida. Su pareja es Adán, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en la casa de su suegra, con ella, su pareja y su hijo Dan, de 15 años.
Su actividad es la confección de ropa, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Se inició hace 19 años como independiente, con una máquina de coser que compró con su propio capital, y en la actualidad ya tiene 6 máquinas para diferentes acabados. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, a parte, le gusta su trabajo por contar con un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hogar, además de dedicarse a algo que le agrada hacer, pues se distrae y se siente una persona productiva. Tiene planes de ampliar el espacio de su taller para mayor comodidad y poder exhibir sus prendas.
Este es su préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, pues hace varios años que conoció sobre sus créditos. Por ello, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Se siente a gusto con los miembros de  su banco comunal, pues los conoce hace mucho y son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, comprará dos máquinas recubridoras valorizadas en 700 y 450 nuevos soles, además de materiales (telas, hilos, elásticos y otros). Adicionalmente desea comprar dos maniquís para la exhibición de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Anith, age 39, is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. She is also cheerful and extroverted. Her partner Adán is a merchant and the father of her two children. Anith lives at her mother-in-law's house with her, her partner, and her 15-year-old son Dan.

Her business involves producing clothes. She learned this trade while studying at a center for occupational education. Anith began working independently at the age of 19 with a sewing machine she bought with her own capital. Now she has six machines that produce different finishes. Anith considers her business to be profitable because of the good revenue that it generates. She also enjoys working because she can have an income to cover her personal and household expenses. Adith also likes to spend time doing something that she enjoys since it provides her with a distraction and makes her feel like a productive individual. She has plans to expand the space in her workshop so that she will feel more comfortable and be able to display her finished garments.

This is her 12th loan with the MFP organization, so she has had several years to become familiar with the loans. Anith promises to be punctual with her payments, just as she was with her previous loans. She gets along well with the other members of her Communal Bank since she has known them for a long time and considers them to be responsible and supportive people. The loan amount of 3,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy two covering machines, valued at 700 PEN and 450 PEN respectively, and sewing materials (fabrics, thread, elastics, and other supplies). Anith will also buy two mannequins for exhibiting her finished garments.

loans.use: to buy two covering machines, sewing materials, and two mannequins.

loans.name: Nemesia De Los Milagros

texts.es: Nemesia de los Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un taller de calzado desde hace 12 años donde realiza aproximadamente 120 pares  mensuales. El crédito lo invertirá en ornas de zapatos, cuero, plantillas…etc.
texts.en: Nemesia de los Milagros is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is a cobbler and works out of a modest artisanal workshop for the past 12 years. There she makes approximately 120 pairs of shoes a day. The loan she is requesting will be invested into shoe decorations, leather, insoles, etc.

loans.use: buy shoe decorations, leather, insoles, etc.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina viven en el sur de Guayaquil en la zona conocida como Guasmo. Tiene 59 años de edad y está casada con Anibal quien es chofer de taxi. Sus hijos son mayores de edad y están casados. Hace 9 años atrás Florentina decidió abrir una tienda, empezó vendiendo arroz, azúcar y colas desde la ventana de su casa. Al principio fue poco a poco porque no conocía  el negocio, el trato y como obtener créditos. Después de un tiempo decidió realizar un préstamo con el cual adecuo el local y surtió la tienda. Hoy en día tiene mucha clientela y atiende de lunes a domingos desde muy temprano, lo realiza sola y cuando su esposo esta le ayuda. Le gusta el negocio porque la mantiene activa y le genera rentabilidad. El préstamo lo va a emplear para comprar mas mercadería esperando así complacer a sus clientes con sus demandas.
texts.en: Florentina lives in the south of Guayaquil in a zone called Guasmo.  She’s 59 years old and married to Anibal who drives a taxi.  Her children are fully grown and are married.  Nine years ago Florentina decided to open a store.  She began by selling rice, sugar, and colas from a window in her home.  At first it was a little at a time because she didn’t know the business, contracts, or how to obtain loans.  After some time she decided to get a loan which she used to expand and stock her store.  Now she has many customers and works Monday to Sunday beginning in the early morning.  She works alone but her husband helps when he is there.  She likes her business because it keeps her active and generates profits.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise and expects to satisfy her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 40-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and four school-aged children. She's a friendly and above all hardworking woman. She's a tailor; she's very talented at her job and has more than twenty years of experience working in the same occupation. She's well known in her area and works upon client's requests from her home. In parallel, she possesses a residence where she benefits from its monthly rental charges. In order to provide the family with extra financial support, her husband became a carpentry owner in his town and also started to work in a local hotel in 2005.

With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l., she will purchase a new tailoring machine as well as mandatory supplies such as textiles, needles, strings and many different items. She is very optimistic and is ambitious to open her own tailoring factory as soon as she can, hoping to enhance her family's way of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine as well as mandatory supplies such as textiles, needles, strings and many different items

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
This is Manale, a 31-year-old married woman who is a resident of Lebanon. With an adorable family of three school-aged children and a husband, she decided to carry on her life despite all circumstances. At this time, she's cooperating with her husband expecting a better and brighter future for her children.

Because her house is located in a strategic spot, Manale decided to start her own business as a tailor four years ago. She works with high professionalism which makes her attract additional clients. We admit that Manale is a brave young woman, although her husband's support is the reason she has attained with her children what they have right now. He's an employee at the CFC, a resident company located on the other side of their town. 

As Manale wants to better develop her business and improve her work as well, she decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a modern tailoring machine which can speed up her work and make it much easier. This Kiva loan will also allow her to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve her income by at least 20%. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream a reality and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase a modern tailoring machine

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is thirty-four years old, single, and runs a second-hand clothing business. He has been in this business for eight years, earning a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it for purchasing more stock of new clothes for business expansion. He plans to use the profit from the business to diversify the business into other areas and prepare for the family in his future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes for business expansion

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi lives south of the city and has a family business, selling groceries such as vegetables, potatoes, onions, etc. Her business started two years ago. She was gradually making progress attracting customers, mainly in the neighborhood.

Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan because she needs her business to grow, and to do that she needs to find suppliers from whom she can buy in volume and on a cash basis, as they offer a better price. This is the reason for this Kiva loan, the third loan that she has taken from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use this loan to buy sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts that will increase her profits right away, and also benefit her customers. Her goal for the future is to have her own place where she could operate a big grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
Paulo es un hombre de 24 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona; él es un joven muy emprendedor que tiene el gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de salir adelante en la vida; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de tener que trabajar para apoyar a su familia, no pudo cursar la carrera de Contabilidad que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Paulo trabaja como chofer de taxi en su vehículo propio, él se dedica a trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 40 clientes, él cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su amabilidad, respeto y buen trato hacia sus clientes.    
Paulo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y mejoramiento de su vehículo, ya que requiere reparar la caja de éste; de esta manera Paulo contará con un vehículo en buenas condiciones y podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y con ello espera poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para dar inicio a sus estudios de contabilidad y así empezar su futuro profesional.
texts.en:
Paulo is a 24 year-old man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica in the Parcona district.  He is an enterprising youth who has a great desire to excel, and who wants to get ahead in life.  Unfortunately, because he lacks resources and needs to support his family, he was not able to pursue the degree in accounting that he wanted, but he hopes to be able to do so soon.

On his own initiative, and thanks to his family's support, Paulo works as a taxi driver in his own vehicle.  He works about 10 hours a day, during which time he is able to serve about 40 customers.  Paulo believes that his business is going well because he provides good service to his customers, and treats them with friendliness and respect.  

Paulo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing, he will be able to make some repairs and improvements to his vehicle.  He needs to repair his transmission.  In this way, Paulo will be able to rely on a vehicle that is in good condition and he will be able to increase his earnings.  With this business, he hopes to be able to save enough money so that he can start his accounting degree, and in this way start his future as a professional.

loans.use: to make some repairs and improvements to his vehicle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her eight children, who are between the ages of 12 and 20. They are all in school and live at home.

For the past fourteen years Mary has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food, cold water and soft drinks. One problem she is facing is the complaining of customers (about the high price of food). She says she makes a lot of profit because she is the only one who prepares a delicious Liberian dish.

Mary started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, onions, peppers, oil, charcoal, cold water and soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, peppers, oil, charcoal, cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Alfredo Junior

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y sobre todo recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año, ya que en esta ciudad se encuentran las líneas de nazca, las cuales son jeroglifos ubicados en un extenso campo árido, los cuales eran usado por la antigua cultura nazca según algunos estudios como un calendario para saber la época de lluvias. Vive al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad a quien ama muchísimo y por quien trabaja ya que el quiere que su hijo sea mejor que el y que sienta orgullo por su padre. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música sobre todo porque lo relaja mucho y también porque en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “pallares con bisteck.
 
Día a día Alfredo trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras en el mercado de su ciudad, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias; el cree que el va bien su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a un buen precio.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como cebolla, papas, ají, coliflor entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una buena educación a su hijo y ser el mejor vendedor de su zona”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 23 years old. He lives in the city of Nazca, which is characterized by having a warm climate and above all by receiving many tourists throughout the year, since the Nazca lines are found in this city. They are hieroglyphics located in an extensive, dry field which were used by the ancient Nazca culture, according to some studies, as a calendar for knowing the rainy season. 

Alfredo lives with his wife and their little son, who is 5 years old and whom he loves very much and for whom he works, since he wants his son to be better than himself and he wants him to feel proud of his father. When he has free time, he likes to listed to music, above all because it relaxes him a lot and also because on some of these occasions he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, which is the very delicious steak with lima beans.

Day after day Alfredo works in his business, selling vegetables in the market of his city. He works at the business about 10 hours a day. He believes that it is going well for him because he is very friendly with the customers and above all because he offers products of quality at a good price.

Alfredo is very thankful to the Kiva loans since thanks to the help that they have offered him he will be able to buy merchandise for his business, such as onions, potatoes, garlic, and cauliflower, among others. This will allow him to have more products to offer his customers and and to improve his income.Thus he will continue working and striving every day to make a reality of his great dream: to give a good education to his son and to be the best vendor in his area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (onions, potatoes, garlic, and cauliflower, among others)

loans.name: Khayriyeh

texts.en:
Khayriyeh is a 29-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s single and lives with her parents and four siblings. She, together with her father, manages the family’s household expenses while operating her business. She has been the owner of a detergents shop since 2010. She sells different types of detergents for floors, windows, glasses, toilets and home appliances. She also sells shampoo and shower gels. Her shop is located in her town where many customers from her community visit her to buy their needed products at good prices. Khayriyeh keeps on working very hard in order to maintain her family’s financial status at a good level. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her product inventory of detergents and shampoos. She barely earns a fair income and she confirms that the loan will help her boost her sales and thus her income by 15%. One of her greatest dreams is to get married and have children; that’s why she’s in real need of amplifying her income in order to be able to make the needed savings for her wedding.

loans.use: to expand her product inventory of detergents and shampoos.

loans.name: Judes De Jesus

texts.es:
Judes, es agricultura, vive con su familia, con su esposa y su abuela, no tiene hijos, esta actividad la inicio gracias al apoyo de sus padres, trabaja en tierra alquilada, no tiene un horario establecido.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como el abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, para aplicarlos a la siembra, pues esto le permite tener lo necesario para que su cultivo sea más productivo.
La aspiración de Judes es que las cosechas sean abundantes, tener su propia casa a futuro, y poder proveerle a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Judes is a farmer. He lives with his family, his spouse and his grandmother; he doesn’t have any children. He started farming thanks to the support from his parents. He works on rented land, with no established schedule. 
He’s requesting a loan to buy agricultural materials, like manure, herbicide and insecticide, to apply to the crops in order to make his crops more productive.
Judes aspires to have abundant crops, own his own house in the future and be able to provide his family with what they need.

loans.use: buy manure, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old man living in Lebanon. He got married to Hanaa, a wonderful and supportive woman. They have five children who are all attending school. One of his greatest dreams is to offer his children a better life especially with being the main income provider in the family. Kahled has been working at a local catering company. They are specialized in preparing and delivering food for any occasion once ready. 

Through his job, he will be able to cover his children's study fees the best he can. Even so, he finds it really hard to stand on his own. To help him continue paying his children's education fees, he asks to take a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. In that way, he will help them achieve a good educational level, even pursuing higher degrees. With this opportunity, his children will start their own business and no doubt have a new and better way of living.

loans.use: to continue paying his children’s education fees

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is thirty years old and married with three children. For the last two years she has been running a hotel business and earning a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET after joining and she plans to use it to purchase more foodstuffs such as meat, chicken, and flour for the business. She also plans to use the profit from the business to purchase a posho mill machine (a machine which grinds maize into flour) and she hopes to become a prosperous lady in the future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as meat, chicken, and flour for the business

loans.name: Retiña

texts.es:
Retiña tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable. Su pareja es Miguel, el padre de sus dos hijos: Britney de 11 años y Fabricio de 6 meses de edad.  Juntos viven en su casa propia.
El negocio que realiza es el comercio de golosinas, bebidas y abarrotes. Los compra en la ciudad para luego enviarlos o llevarlos, en lancha por el río, a un caserío donde trabaja su pareja en el lavado de oro. Realizan la venta de sus productos en una tienda que tienen instalada en ese caserío. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad más de 4 años. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es tener solvencia económica, gracias a las ganancias que le deja, pues le permite arreglar su casa, realizar los viajes a los caseríos y ahorrar, ya que tiene planes de abrir una tienda en alguna zona comercial céntrica de la ciudad.
Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros personas responsables y solidarias.
Con  el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes y golosinas, así como también para el costo del transporte fluvial para la venta de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Retiña, age 28, is a hardworking and industrious woman. She is also cheerful and sociable. Her partner Miguel is the father of her two children: Britney (age 11) and Fabricio (age 6 months). They live together in their own home.

Retiña has a business in which she sells candy, beverages, and groceries. She buys her products in the city and then has them shipped by boat down the river to the village where her partner works panning for gold. Retiña sells her products in a store that they established in the village. She has been in this business for more than four years. She enjoys her business because she is able to be financially solvent. Thanks to the income she generates, Retiña is able to make repairs to her house, travel to other villages, and set aside some savings. She has plans to open a store in a centralized commercial area of the city.

This is her third loan with the MFP organization. Retiña is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible. She promises to complete her payments, just as she did with her previous loans. Retiña feels comfortable with her Communal Bank and considers the members to be responsible and supportive people. The loan amount of 2,000 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of more groceries and candy. She will also pay the cost of river transport so that she can sell the merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and candy and to pay the cost of transporting the goods.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert has been active in farming for nearly 40 years. He currently produces beans, cowpeas, potatoes and maize, which go to the local market. He is married with 10 children, with the last four still in school.

Robert has requested a loan of 52,500 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help improve his family's living standards and educate the last children. His future plan is to venture into fish farming too.

He laments the high cost of pesticides and transportation.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 60-year-old man. He lives in Lebanon. He’s married to Joumana, his soul mate and the mother of his two children. Despite his older age, Jamal is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for covering his family expenses, especially his child’s education fees. His youngest child is also working in order to supplement the family income. Jamal owns a snack shop where he provides his customers with delicious sandwiches, such as “Falafel”, one of the Lebanese traditional foods, and dishes that have been passed down from generation to generation. 

In parallel, he owns three apartments and he benefits from their rental fees. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. - to improve his business by purchasing additional food provisions, as he plans to start offering a wider variety of sandwiches, such as chicken, meat, etc 

In the near future, Jamal will require a break and a rest, so he must act fast to let his son handle his business and maybe hire new employees to help him achieve the work tasks.

loans.use: to purchase additional food provisions.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мире  40 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей, младшей из которых 9 месяцев. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, с 1993 года Мира занимается животноводством, стартовав с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодня в хозяйстве Миры имеется 7 дойных коров с приплодом, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль  от продажи молока и молочных продуктов  составляет 5,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Мира планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Mira is 40 years old, married and has five children. Her youngest is only 9 month old. She has been raising livestock since 1993 to provide for her family. Mira started her business with 1,000 som (KGS) and currently owns 7 milk cows with calves and 10 sheep. Her monthly profits from the sale of milk and dairy products are 5,500 som (KGS). In order to expand her herd and purchase additional cattle Mira has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS). She is planning to invest the profits from this expansion into her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул – лидер группы «Азамат», объединяющей еще двух женщин – участниц. Айнагул 53  года, замужем,  имеет 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1992 году Айнагул начала  заниматься животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Ainagul is the group leader for the Azamat group which includes two more women. Ainagul is 53 years old, married and has three children. She has been raising livestock and farming since 1992. Ainagul's farm began with a starting investment of 5,000 som (KGS) and now yields 12,000 som (KGS) of monthly profits from the sale of milk and dairy products. In order to grow her business Ainagul has turned to "Bai-Tushum" and partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). She is planning to use the money to purchase additional sheep and goats for her herd. In the future Ainagul is planning to continue investing her profits back in to her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Carlos Fonseca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Carlos Fonseca lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marisol quien desde hace 17 años puso una pequeña venta de chiverías, la cual gracias a su arduo trabajo y los crédito ha ido creciendo hasta tener una pulpería en la cual invertirá el crédito en la compra de granos básicos. 
Las otras integrantes son Isabel quien vende ropa y cosméticos, y Elsa vende cosméticos desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
The Group Carlos Fonseca is made up of three entrepreneurial, hardworking women. One of the group members is Marisol, who 17 years ago started a small store. Thanks to her hard work and the support she has received, she has been able to grow her business into a thriving convenience store. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase staple grains for resale.

The other group members are Isabel, who sells clothing and cosmetics, and Elsa, who sells has been selling cosmetics for four years.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains for resale.

loans.name: Pieterinah

texts.en:
Pieterinah is a married woman and has nine children. She lives in Kwale, Kenya, where she makes a living by running a restaurant business. Her business is preparing and selling food to customers at her restaurant. Little by little, she has gained from neighbors in the surrounding area where she lives. This is her principal market. Her greatest wish is to have a well-equipped restaurant to develop her business more comfortably, because her greatest challenge to growing her business is the small space she has. 

Her shopping is done daily and her transportation expenses increase the cost of her products. For this reason she needs to buy in greater quantity and decrease the frequency of her shopping so she can qualify for volume discounts and be more competitive. This is why she has turned to Credit Kiva, her third loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With this loan she will buy supplies for the preparation of meals, bundles of wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Harriet sells cereals at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of cow peas and beans. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so as to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cow peas and beans.

loans.name: Nasriddin
